        <p class="date">
         Tue Jul 31, 2007 at 06:34 AM PDT
        </p>
        <h2>
         <a href="/story/2007/07/31/364689/-I-just-returned-from-Falafel-Bill-s-house" id="titleHref">
          I just returned from Falafel Bill's house
         </a>
         <span style="white-space: nowrap">
         </span>
        </h2>
        <p class="author">
         <span>
          by
         </span>
         <a href="/user/Mike Stark">
          Mike Stark
         </a>
         <a alt="Follow this author" class="ajax type-user do-hotlist do-updateContent size-tiny off altTooltip" href="#?friend_id=7059&amp;is_stream=1">
          Follow
         </a>
        </p>
        <ul class="front-page-share clearfix">
         <li style="margin-left: 0px">
          <div class="fb-share-button" data-href="http://www.dailykos.com/story/2007/07/31/364689/-I-just-returned-from-Falafel-Bill-s-house" data-layout="button_count">
          </div>
         </li>
         <li>
          <a class="twitter-share-button" data-count="horizontal" data-related="markos" data-text="I just returned from Falafel Bill's house" data-url="http://www.dailykos.com/story/2007/07/31/364689/-I-just-returned-from-Falafel-Bill-s-house" data-via="dailykos" href="https://twitter.com/share">
           Tweet
          </a>
         </li>
         <li>
          <a class="comments comment_count_with_new" data-comment_count="1572" data-story_id="364689" href="/story/2007/07/31/364689/-I-just-returned-from-Falafel-Bill-s-house#comments">
           1572 Comments
          </a>
         </li>
        </ul>
       </div>
       <div class="article-body">
        <div id="intro">
         <p>
          After O'Reilly provided an "accountability moment" to the JetBlue CEO at his home, I decided to provide O'Reilly with his own accountability moment at his home.
         </p>
         <p>
          I've just returned to home base.
         </p>
         <p>
          I've got video of O'Reilly in his sleepwear (red shorts and a white t-shirt). I delivered the Andrea Mackris Court filings to all of his neighors - every home in his development got a copy. And I put a bunch of signs up along his street - "Bill O'Reilly: Andrea Mackris has your cash" directly across from his house; "Bill O'Reilly: PERVERT" in front of his home; "Bill O'Reilly: CHEATER" on the road he must take to exit his development and "Bill O'Reilly: Can't be trusted with your daughters" at the landmark boulder marking the entrance to his development.
         </p>
         <p>
          We had an interesting conversation - not too explosive, but I think a lot of people will be entertained.
         </p>
         <p>
          Video soon (I'd like to debut it a YearlyKos - until then, I've got pictures to share).
         </p>
         <p>
          Special thanks to Ken from DownWithTyranny, without whom this could not have been done.
         </p>
         <p>
          Photos by Alan Zimmerman.
         </p>
         <p>
          Pics after the flip...
         </p>
        </div>
        <p class="divider-doodle">
        </p>
        <div class="article-body" id="body">
         <blockquote>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Final Update [2007-7-31 11:38:59 by Mike Stark]:
           </strong>
           Someone emailed me. My response:
          </p>
          <blockquote>
           <p>
            <em>
             everyone has their limits... and i appreciate the decent email.
            </em>
           </p>
           <p>
            that said, my limits are not your limits. I had plenty of justification for doing what I did, and by holding O'reilly to his own standard, well, if he complains about it, then I will have exposed his hypocrisy.
           </p>
           <p>
            Somebody in the comments of the DKos diary amde a good point: this is kinda like everyone bashing Michael Moore for doing pretty much exactly the same thing I did.
           </p>
           <p>
            In the end, between Bill O'Reilly and I, one of us is on the side of the angels... and I guess that's for each individual to decide.
           </p>
           <p>
            All I know is that he is a truly awful human being and an incredibly effective propagandist. That's a dangerous combination, and I'm proud of my work.
           </p>
          </blockquote>
          <p>
           Some have suggested that I'm not a journalist or a reporter because I engaged in advocacy while pursuing my work.
          </p>
          <p>
           Wrong.
          </p>
          <p>
           Michael Moore makes documentaries. It's journalism. It's legitimate. My diary and my movie will serve to inform. The fact that it's done in a novel way takes nothing away from the fact that I'm telling a story based on objective facts.
          </p>
         </blockquote>
         <blockquote>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Update 2 [2007-7-31 10:16:59 by Mike Stark]:
           </strong>
           Clearing a coupla things up:
          </p>
          <p>
           I contacted O'Reilly's producer (and recorded the voicemails and archived the email - 3 times to let him know I wanted to interview him. I never heard back.
          </p>
          <p>
           Bill O'Reilly threatened, on national radio, to come to my house and "
           <a href="http://www.callingallwingnuts.com/2006/03/03/oreilly-blast-from-the-past/">
            surprise me
           </a>
           ". I'll link the audio soon. (now linked) Just last week, he threatened to visit the home of an oil company CEO. I did not do a thing that O'Reilly hasn't advocated several times himself.
          </p>
          <p>
           And this wasn't stalking. It was reporting. I'm a reporter and I went out and got the story from a hostile subject. Y'all should be able to tell the difference between "stalking" and getting the story.
          </p>
         </blockquote>
         <blockquote>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Update [2007-7-31 10:6:59 by Mike Stark]:
           </strong>
           Wanted to address the naysayers: please take your concern to your own diaries. My opening statement to Bill was that I was providing an accountability moment.
          </p>
          <p>
           It's wrong to confront good people at their homes. It's absolutely the right thing to do to confront liars, cheats and fools that are fucking this country wherever and whenever you can find them.
          </p>
          <p>
           If BillO's your hero, fine, concern-troll away all morning. Just please do me the favor of taking it to your own diaries. If you, like me, understand that there was no way I'd get close to BillO' at Fox; that this was the only way to let him know that he's not above answering for his loathsome lies... answering directly to the people he's smearing... Well, thank you for your support.
          </p>
          <p>
           One last thing. This project cost me a weeks time and hundreds of dollars. If you're inclined to support good behaviour, I've got a PayPal link up at
           <a href="http://www.callingallwingnuts.com">
            CallingAllWingnuts.com
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p>
           See y'all at YearlyKos!!
          </p>
         </blockquote>
         <p>
          Not sure if you can read this or not, but the stamp reads:
         </p>
         <blockquote>
          <p>
           Urgent
           <br/>
           Nassau County Pervert Alert
          </p>
          <p>
           Bill O'Reilly
           <br/>
           blocked
          </p>
         </blockquote>
         <p>
          (btw - the previously posted (inadvertantly) pic with the address does not reveal his real address, but people in his neighborhood will know - I kinda used synonyms because I'm not sure it's appropriate to publish his address to the masses)
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/10841966@N08/962202653/" title="Photo Sharing">
           <img alt="The envelope" height="333" src="http://farm2.static.flickr.com/1348/962202653_8ea1418a6b.jpg" width="500"/>
          </a>
         </p>
         <p>
          In front of Falafel Bill's domocile:
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/10841966@N08/962841692/" title="Photo Sharing">
           <img alt="O'Reilly's landmark entrance to his driveway" height="333" src="http://farm2.static.flickr.com/1187/962841692_136cc8694c.jpg" width="500"/>
          </a>
         </p>
         <p>
          Directly across the street from Falafel Bill's abode:
          <br/>
          <br/>
          <a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/10841966@N08/962841926/" title="Photo Sharing">
           <img alt="Directly across the street from Falafel Bill's abode" height="333" src="http://farm2.static.flickr.com/1051/962841926_85755f2761.jpg" width="500"/>
          </a>
         </p>
         <p>
          We chat a bit:
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/10841966@N08/962841726/" title="Photo Sharing">
           <img alt="I chat with Falafel Bill" height="333" src="http://farm2.static.flickr.com/1298/962841726_87bedb38d5.jpg" width="500"/>
          </a>
         </p>
         <p>
          He cuts the conversation short:
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/10841966@N08/962841750/" title="Photo Sharing">
           <img alt="Falafel Bill doesn't want to chat." height="333" src="http://farm2.static.flickr.com/1172/962841750_ab35ecec3a.jpg" width="500"/>
          </a>
         </p>
         <p>
          We wave goodbye:
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="http://www.flickr.com/photos/10841966@N08/962929636/" title="Photo Sharing">
           <img alt="Hi neighbors!!" height="333" src="http://farm2.static.flickr.com/1058/962929636_402222560f.jpg" width="500"/>
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>

     <div class="is-popup show-on-load " id="popup-story_setTags" title="Add Diary Tags:">
      <div class="info-bar">
       You must add at least one tag to this diary before publishing it.
      </div>
      <div class="status-bar">
      </div>
      <div class="content-bar">
       <form action="/ajax/story/setTags" class="do-validate on-popup-do-reload" method="POST">
        <input name="story_id" type="hidden" value="364689"/>
        <style>
         #popup-story_setTags div.content-bar p { font-size: 13px; text-align: left; }
	#popup-story_setTags div.content-bar a			{ color: #E5721E }
	#popup-story_setTags div.content-bar a:hover,
	#popup-story_setTags div.content-bar a:focused,
	#popup-story_setTags div.content-bar a:visited	{ color: #7C470C }
        </style>
        <br/>
        <div>
         <p>
          Add keywords that describe this diary.
		Separate multiple keywords with commas.
          <br/>
          <a href="/special/tag_tips" target="_blank">
           Tagging tips
          </a>
          -
          <a href="/search?search_tags=1" target="_blank">
           Search For Tags
          </a>
          -
          <a href="http://www.dkosopedia.com/wiki/Tag:Tagfinder" target="_blank">
           Browse For Tags
          </a>
         </p>
         <div class="pageTip hasTooltip" style="margin-top:3px">
          ?
         </div>
         <div class="tooltipContents qtip-style-dk4_large qtip-pos-br">
          <p>
           <b>
            More Tagging tips:
           </b>
          </p>
          <p>
           A tag is a way to search for this diary. If someone is searching for "Barack Obama," is this a diary they'd be trying to find?
          </p>
          <p>
           Use a person's full name, without any title. Senator Obama may become President Obama, and Michelle Obama might run for office.
          </p>
          <p>
           If your diary covers an election or elected official, use election tags, which are generally the state abbreviation followed by the office. 
		CA-01 is the first district House seat. CA-Sen covers both senate races. NY-GOV covers the New York governor's race.
          </p>
          <p>
           Tags do not compound: that is, "education reform" is a completely different tag from "education". A tag like "reform" alone is probably not meaningful.
          </p>
         </div>
         <!-- &lt;h4 id="p_tagErrorMessage"&gt;You must enter at least one Tag for this Diary Entry:&lt;/h4&gt; -->
         <p>
          <input id="p_tagInput" name="tag_draft" size="70" type="text" value=""/>
          <!-- &lt;input id="tagSubmit" type="submit" name="submit" value="Submit" /&gt; -->
         </p>
         <p style="font-style:italic">
          Consider if one or more of these tags fits your diary:
          <a href="#" onclick="addTagToField('Civil Rights');return false;">
           Civil Rights
          </a>
          ,
          <a href="#" onclick="addTagToField('Community');return false;">
           Community
          </a>
          ,
          <a href="#" onclick="addTagToField('Congress');return false;">
           Congress
          </a>
          ,
          <a href="#" onclick="addTagToField('Culture');return false;">
           Culture
          </a>
          ,
          <a href="#" onclick="addTagToField('Economy');return false;">
           Economy
          </a>
          ,
          <a href="#" onclick="addTagToField('Education');return false;">
           Education
          </a>
          ,
          <a href="#" onclick="addTagToField('Elections');return false;">
           Elections
          </a>
          ,
          <a href="#" onclick="addTagToField('Energy');return false;">
           Energy
          </a>
          ,
          <a href="#" onclick="addTagToField('Environment');return false;">
           Environment
          </a>
          ,
          <a href="#" onclick="addTagToField('Health Care');return false;">
           Health Care
          </a>
          ,
          <a href="#" onclick="addTagToField('International');return false;">
           International
          </a>
          ,
          <a href="#" onclick="addTagToField('Labor');return false;">
           Labor
          </a>
          ,
          <a href="#" onclick="addTagToField('Law');return false;">
           Law
          </a>
          ,
          <a href="#" onclick="addTagToField('Media');return false;">
           Media
          </a>
          ,
          <a href="#" onclick="addTagToField('Meta');return false;">
           Meta
          </a>
          ,
          <a href="#" onclick="addTagToField('National Security');return false;">
           National Security
          </a>
          ,
          <a href="#" onclick="addTagToField('Science');return false;">
           Science
          </a>
          ,
          <a href="#" onclick="addTagToField('Transportation');return false;">
           Transportation
          </a>
          , or
          <a href="#" onclick="addTagToField('White House');return false;">
           White House
          </a>
          .
	If your diary is specific to a state, consider adding the state 
	(
          <a href="#" onclick="addTagToField('California');return false;">
           California
          </a>
          ,
          <a href="#" onclick="addTagToField('Texas');return false;">
           Texas
          </a>
          , etc).
	Keep in mind, though, that there are many wonderful and important diaries
	that don't fit in any of these tags. Don't worry if yours doesn't.
         </p>
        </div>
       </form>
      </div>

              <p>
               did you do today?

               <div class="ct">
                <p>
                 goes to anyone's house to confront them. What Mike did is not stalking; it's exposing him and reminding people of what Bill has done.
                </p>
                <p>
                 And Mike showed class by not publishing Bill's address which some on the Right would do if they were in the same position.
                </p>

                  that I get when I see coverage of protestors picketing the homes of abortion providers.

                    <a href="/user/uid:107216">
                     willb48
                    </a>
                    ,
                    <a href="/user/uid:115340">
                     shadetree mortician
                    </a>
                    ,
                    <a href="/user/uid:116231">
                     Fiona West
                    </a>
                    ,
                    <a href="/user/uid:118824">
                     Residentcynic
                    </a>
                    ,
                    <a href="/user/uid:119674">
                     inHI
                    </a>
                    ,
                    <a href="/user/uid:121152">
                     MsWings
                    </a>
                    ,
                    <a href="/user/uid:125583">
                     Aerion
                    </a>
                    ,
                    <a href="/user/uid:125880">
                     Garden Neighbor
                    </a>
                    ,
                    <a href="/user/uid:128110">
                     BlueGenes
                    </a>
                   </dd>
                  </dl>
                 </div>
                 <div class="ct">
                  <p>
                   ...to a sleazy tactic known as "Shuddering Into Silence" done by the UFO-nut-cult Scientology.
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   I've supported Mike in the past.
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   I'm not with him on this one. Period.
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   Ambush him at his house for a boxer-short interview, sure. That's what he's done. Make sure the info on his execrable behavior in the Macris affair is widely known to his viewers, sure. But leave the two separate.
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   Maybe my stance doesn't make sense to you--but with Karl Rove borrowing Scientology's tactics, I don't think we need to as well.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                 <div class="cf">
                  <p class="sig">
                   Rubus Eradicandus Est.
                  </p>
                  <p class="cb">
                   by
                   <a href="/user/uid:6942">
                    Randomfactor
                   </a>
                   on
                   <a href="/comments/364689/12779837#c103">

                   </a>
                  </p>
                  <p class="cl">

                   <a href="#c68">

                   </a>

                  </p>

                      <div class="ct">
                       <p>
                        Even though it is private property, without a sign stating no solicatations or Mr. Bill asking that Mike leave the property and Mike refusing, it's totally fine. Outside spaces are not considered by the law to carry reasonable expectations of privacy since you are in the "public view".
                       </p>

                    <li id="c1076">
                     <div class="cx" id="cx12784718">
                      <h5>
                       <a class="de">
                       </a>
                       <span class="cu">
                        Are you doing this in the name of this community?
                       </span>
                       <span class="crd ntb">
                        (
                        <a href="/comments/364689/12784718#c1076?mode=alone;showrate=1#c1076">
                         5+ / 0-
                        </a>
                        )
                       </span>
                      </h5>
                      <div class="crs">
                       <dl>
                        <dt>

                        </dt>
                        <dd>
                         <a href="/user/uid:38993">

                         </a>

                         <a href="/user/uid:55121">
                          LNK
                         </a>
                         ,
                         <a href="/user/uid:95331">

                         </a>

                         <a href="/user/uid:102654">

                         </a>
                         ,
                         <a href="/user/uid:128110">
                          BlueGenes
                         </a>
                        </dd>
                       </dl>
                      </div>
                      <div class="ct">
                       <p>
                        I certainly don't agree with what you have done or posting this diary up here. While maybe I'm off base, your posting of this seems to me to imply that there is an endorsement of your actions, and that you are somehow acting as an agent of the community or Markos.
                       </p>
                       <p>
                        Mike, I respect a lot of what you have done. But doing this, and then posting it, and debuting it at YearlyKos seems to me to show at best questionble judgment.
                       </p>

                          aaraujo
                         </a>
                         ,
                         <a href="/user/uid:69938">
                          kestrel9000
                         </a>
                         ,
                         <a href="/user/uid:72353">
                          blueoasis
                         </a>
                         ,
                         <a href="/user/uid:79015">
                          Clive all hat no horse Rodeo

                         <a href="/user/uid:89713">

                         <a href="/user/uid:123198">

                         <a href="/user/uid:123726">
                          TL Eclipse
                         </a>
                         ,
                         <a href="/user/uid:127743">
                          gopher747
                         </a>
                        </dd>
                       </dl>
                      </div>
                      <div class="ct">
                       <p>
                        "Bill O'Reilly threatened, on national radio, to come to my house and 'surprise me.'"
                       </p>
                       <p>
                        O'Reilly has the bully pulpit, and used it to bully: that Bill should have his own avowed tactic used against him is only justice.
                       </p>
                       <p>
                        Such concern for doing the "right" thing -- hey, if O'Reilly threatened to stalk me, I think it would be genius to turn his tactics back on him.
                       </p>
                       <p>
                        As well as supplying an accountability moment: damning O'Reilly with his own words and actions.
                       </p>
                       <p>
                        Can't think of a more apt response.
                       </p>
                       <p>
                        And Daily Kos will survive a justice prank, in it's own name, or not.
                       </p>
                      </div>

                       <a class="de">

                       <span class="cu">
                        even "no solicitation" is open for debate
                       </span>
                       <span class="crd ntb">
                        (
                        <a href="/comments/364689/12787314#c1208?mode=alone;showrate=1#c1208">
                         1+ / 0-
                        </a>
                        )
                       </span>
                      </h5>
                      <div class="crs">
                       <dl>
                        <dt>
                         Recommended by:
                        </dt>
                        <dd>
                         <a href="/user/uid:66840">
                          kraant
                         </a>
                        </dd>
                       </dl>
                      </div>
                      <div class="ct">
                       <p>
                        Political speech, including canvassing and petition-gathering, is generally not considered solicitation. It is, however, considered trespassing, but only if there is a posted "no trespassing" sign or if the resident demands you leave.
                       </p>
                      </div>
                      <div class="cf">
                       <p class="sig">
                        The American people are competent.  Why shouldn't the government be competent?  The people tell the truth.  Why should our government lie?

-Jimmy Carter

                 <li id="c856">
                  <div class="cx" id="cx12782496">
                   <h5>
                    <a class="de">
                    </a>
                    <span class="cu">
                     what?  Your comment?
                    </span>
                    <span class="crd ntb">
                     (
                     <a href="/comments/364689/12782496#c856?mode=alone;showrate=1#c856">
                      16+ / 0-
                     </a>
                     )
                    </span>
                   </h5>
                   <div class="crs">
                    <dl>
                     <dt>
                      Recommended by:
                     </dt>
                     <dd>
                      <a href="/user/uid:3930">
                       vivacia

                      </a>
                      ,
                      <a href="/user/uid:67123">

                      </a>

                      <a href="/user/uid:73918">
                       harrylimelives
                      </a>

                      </a>

                      <a href="/user/uid:79015">

                      </a>
                      ,
                      <a href="/user/uid:123726">
                       TL Eclipse
                      </a>
                     </dd>
                    </dl>
                   </div>
                   <div class="ct">
                    <p>
                     What makes you say that? The sidewalks and streets are public property. As long as you do not insert materials into a mailbox there's no problem and Stark wasn't camping out on his lawn so instead of hassling a guy who has the balls to get out there and confront the bullies and liars, why not simply acknowledge you, yourself have no stomach for what it takes to actively confront the right, which is fine, because not everyone has it them but do not say Mr. Stark is not very smart when you obviously put no thought into your own words. I think the Repubs have really gotten to a lot of people because it seems like so many leaving comments here don't realize this is still the United States. You should be thanking this fellow for all his hard work. This is what a hero looks like.
                    </p>
                   </div>

                     </span>

                    <div class="ct">
                     <p>
                      Okay, I don't want to hear about being a better person or just ignoring that idiot OReilly. Mike didn't cross any lines. Newsflash - OReilly has dedicated himself to belittling you. He is using a classic GOP trick: find out what your weakness' are then accuse your enemy of those same weaknesses before he can accuse you. You can't ignore O'reilly into shutting up; you have to stand up to him like any other bully. Go to his house. If you see him in the streets call him names. Bring the pressure and bring it hard. This is my problem with the Democrats; they just roll over and take the abuse. There are probably many people like me, people who would consider joining the Dems but wont because the Dems lack spines.
                     </p>
                     <p>
                      GROW A PAIR!!!!!!!
                     </p>
                     <p>
                      That is not to say physically accost him, obviously. But the same freedom of speech that allows O'Reilly to call each and every one of you a Nazi allows you to call him a @!#$!
                     </p>
                     <p>
                      Ill go back to lurking now.
                     </p>

                      <div class="ct">
                       <p>
                        We're a community, right? Of progressives, Democrats, liberals.
                       </p>
                       <p>
                        Within this community, some of us are the intellectuals, some of us the workers, and whatever. Well, we also need an army. Those who go out and put up their dukes. For us. Or, you could think of them as the sewage treatment guys, cleaning out the crap. (g)
                       </p>
                       <p>
                        We need the them just as much as we need everybody else, and I will not criticize them.
                       </p>
                       <p>
                        That's how I look at it.
                       </p>

                      <div class="ct">
                       <p>
                        I can see where you'd say you have no problem with confrontation.
                       </p>
                       <p>
                        But seriously, as part of several different communities with affinity (geographic, political, artistic) the only place where you could have an agreement on message would be in a mission statement to which people were asked or required to adhere.
                       </p>
                       <p>
                        You could make the argument that Mike Stark isn't helping get Democrats elected by pulling the stunt he did, but then again someone else could make the opposite argument.
                       </p>
                       <p>
                        Maybe lots of people will be happy that someone finally stepped up and pointed out some of the realities of the person behind the hate-speaker on FOX.
                       </p>
                       <p>
                        Maybe happy enough to give money and time to candidates that stand in opposition to people like O' Reilly.
                       </p>
                       <p>
                        Even my 85 year old mom just quickly summed the whole thing up by saying: "Well, O'Reilly deserves it."
                       </p>

                 <div class="ct">
                  <p>
                   and it is important to talk about it. I think what Mike has done is a tactic of confrontation against a person who does not respond to any reasonable ideas of goodwill.
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   He has an agenda which includes partly the destruction of our Constitution. He's not a well-meaning person who just makes an occasional mistake. We have very little legal power to stop him. The media and the courts let them get away with using their platforms to lie and distort the issues.
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   While cable is not a legal public resource as the airwaves I think we can make the case that the responsible use of them is in the public and national best interests.
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   But we are not there yet so we have to make as much noise as we can so that more people hear us. It's not enough for us to talk to each other. We know what's going on but there is not enough of the general public to know it. That's where we come in.
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   As my friend buhdydhrma says "yell louder" and Mike is doing a fantastic job of that.
                  </p>

                  <span class="cu">
                   O'Reilly has stalked Dr. George Tiller
                  </span>
                  <span class="crd ntb">
                   (
                   <a href="/comments/364689/12789661#c1326?mode=alone;showrate=1#c1326">
                    4+ / 0-
                   </a>
                   )
                  </span>
                 </h5>
                 <div class="crs">

                 <div class="ct">
                  <p>
                   and
                   <a href="http://www.foxnews.com/story/0,2933,281861,00.html">
                    aired the video
                   </a>
                   .
                  </p>
                  <blockquote>
                   <p>
                    O'REILLY: [W]e asked Dr. Tiller to comment. He would not. So "Factor" producer Porter Barry went to him.
                   </p>
                   <p>
                    (BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)
                   </p>
                   <p>
                    PORTER BARRY, "FACTOR" PRODUCER: Why are you one of the only doctors who does these kind of abortions?
                   </p>
                   <p>
                    TILLER: Nice day isn't it?
                   </p>
                   <p>
                    BARRY: They call you Tiller, the baby Killer. Is that appropriate? .
                   </p>
                   <p>
                    TILLER: I'm think I'm going to get in my car and go to work.
                   </p>
                   <p>
                    BARRY: Dr. Tiller, don't you think...
                   </p>
                   <p>
                    TILLER: Hi, is this 911? This is Dr. George Tiller. I am at Edgemoore and Harry at QuickTrip. I'm being accosted by the people from O'Reilly. Yes, and they are preventing me from getting in my car and leaving.
                   </p>
                   <p>
                    BARRY: You can get in your car and go, Dr. Tiller.
                   </p>
                   <p>
                    (END VIDEO CLIP)
                   </p>
                  </blockquote>
                 </div>
                 <div class="cf">

                </div>
                <div class="ct">
                 <p>
                  Here is how you follow up on what you did, in a quite proper and legal manner. In fact, it may even save money for the poor unfortunates who live near Mr. O'Reilly's abode.
                 </p>
                 <p>
                  First check up on the property tax assessment appeals process there, to find out when residents can request an appeal of their property assessments. Then send letters to each of O'Reilly neighbors, pointing out at length O'Reilly's record of perversion and noting that "surely having this scoundrel for a neighbor has depressed your property value below what the government officials claim it to be." Then outline how they can file an appeal of their assessments.
                 </p>
                 <p>
                  Assuming that O'Reilly's neighbors are tax-hating folk (which is likely, else why would the SOB have move there in the first place), they will LOVE the idea of getting a break on their property taxes, even at the expense of admitting O'Reilly's many character flaws!
                 </p>
                </div>
                <div class="cf">
                 <p class="sig">
                 </p>

              <li id="c1199">
               <div class="cx" id="cx12787077">
                <h5>
                 <a class="de">
                 </a>
                 <span class="cu">
                  On balance, I support what Mike did here.
                 </span>
                 <span class="crd ntb">
                  (
                  <a href="/comments/364689/12787077#c1199?mode=alone;showrate=1#c1199">
                   2+ / 0-
                  </a>
                  )
                 </span>
                </h5>
                <div class="crs">
                 <dl>
                  <dt>
                   Recommended by:
                  </dt>
                  <dd>
                   <a href="/user/uid:40243">
                    CanYouBeAngryAndStillDream
                   </a>
                   ,
                   <a href="/user/uid:49336">
                    Tonedevil
                   </a>
                  </dd>
                 </dl>
                </div>
                <div class="ct">
                 <p>
                  I would have preferred to see Mike do exactly what O'Reilly's goons have frequently done to newspaper people and judges, but no more than that, i.e., I would have preferred that this be done without the signs and the court filings distribution.
                 </p>
                 <p>
                  It is now a standard O'Reilly technique to send his goons with cameras to the houses of judges and newspaper editors, asking them why they support child molesters, etc.
                 </p>
                 <p>
                  Thus, I have no problem with Mike Stark doing the same sort of thing to O'Reilly.
                 </p>
                 <p>
                  But, some stuff Mike did here was a tad excessive.
                 </p>
                </div>

                   <li id="c1088">
                    <div class="cx" id="cx12784883">
                     <h5>
                      <a class="de">
                      </a>
                      <span class="cu">
                       Mike doesn't speak for me
                      </span>
                      <span class="crd ntb">
                       (
                       <a href="/comments/364689/12784883#c1088?mode=alone;showrate=1#c1088">
                        8+ / 0-
                       </a>
                       )
                      </span>
                     </h5>
                     <div class="crs">
                      <dl>
                       <dt>
                        Recommended by:
                       </dt>
                       <dd>
                        <a href="/user/uid:2216">
                         CJB
                        </a>
                        ,
                        <a href="/user/uid:4147">
                         wystler
                        </a>
                        ,
                        <a href="/user/uid:15714">
                         delver rootnose
                        </a>
                        ,
                        <a href="/user/uid:64210">
                         Jim P
                        </a>
                        ,
                        <a href="/user/uid:79484">
                         ticket punch
                        </a>
                        ,
                        <a href="/user/uid:102654">
                         SeaTurtle
                        </a>
                        ,
                        <a href="/user/uid:111341">
                         AnnieJo
                        </a>
                        ,
                        <a href="/user/uid:124506">
                         HenryVane
                        </a>
                       </dd>
                      </dl>
                     </div>
                     <div class="ct">
                      <p>
                       He speaks for himself . If he wants to do this as the lone ranger, fine. But to provide it to this site as exclusive content, by stepping into the middle of this and making a public spectacle, it crosses the line.
                      </p>
                      <p>
                       In my opinion this kind of action has the potential to affect the way that people view this site and the community, and could reduce its effectiveness. I think Mike's actions in front of O'Reilly's house are fine. But his actions here, posting this diary, and then debuting his video at YearlyKos exhibit poor judgment.
                      </p>
                     </div>
                     <div class="cf">
                      <p class="sig">
                      </p>

                <div class="ct">
                 <p>
                  arte criticizing this, I thought it was fucking brilliant.
                 </p>
                 <p>
                  Let's see, Bill'O
                  <em>
                   is a pervert
                  </em>
                  who has, on numerous occasions
                  <em>
                   inappropriately propositioned/sexually harrassed young women
                  </em>
                  in order to satisfy his little fantasies.
                 </p>
                 <p>
                  He lost millions of dollars in a lawsuit because of this behavior.
                 </p>
                 <p>
                  He ambushes targets
                  <em>
                   all the time on his show.
                  </em>
                 </p>
                 <p>
                  His "Talking Points Memo" that often accompanies his ambushes are in no way different from the the signs Mike Stark put up around Bill's house (wait, there is a diiference, Mike's signs happened to be true).
                 </p>
                 <p>
                  Mike turned the tables on O'Reilly, and good for him.
                 </p>
                 <p>
                  O'Reilly deserves what he got and more. He just got a small taste of what he dishes out every day, often times to private citizens. Other celebrities have to deal with papparrazzi shadowin their every move and picking through their trash. I think Bill can handle getting confronted just one time.
                 </p>
                </div>

                <li id="c713">
                 <div class="cx" id="cx12781690">
                  <h5>
                   <a class="de">
                   </a>
                   <span class="cu">
                    actually, I (humbly) disagree with you....
                   </span>
                   <span class="crd ntb">
                    (
                    <a href="/comments/364689/12781690#c713?mode=alone;showrate=1#c713">
                     8+ / 0-
                    </a>
                    )
                   </span>
                  </h5>
                  <div class="crs">
                   <dl>
                    <dt>
                     Recommended by:
                    </dt>
                    <dd>
                     <a href="/user/uid:76">
                      Sharoney
                     </a>
                     ,
                     <a href="/user/uid:181">
                      Rebecca
                     </a>
                     ,
                     <a href="/user/uid:4540">
                      jennybravo
                     </a>
                     ,
                     <a href="/user/uid:18605">
                      opinionated
                     </a>
                     ,
                     <a href="/user/uid:49336">
                      Tonedevil
                     </a>
                     ,
                     <a href="/user/uid:59624">
                      HiBob
                     </a>
                     ,
                     <a href="/user/uid:75329">
                      JVolvo
                     </a>
                     ,
                     <a href="/user/uid:120711">
                      Wek
                     </a>
                    </dd>
                   </dl>
                  </div>
                  <div class="ct">
                   <p>
                    putting your (Mike's) name on it is somewhat honorable....NOT putting your name on it is more of a cowardly gesture. I may not have done what Mike did, but I don't fault him for what he did. I didn't see a KOS or DKos sign anywhere....the fact that he posted his "adventure" here is "nothing to see here, move along" - in my opinion.
                   </p>
                   <p>
                    If Bill O' doesn't want to subject himself to random people knocking on his door - then build a wall and a gate.....
                   </p>
                   <p>
                    jus' sayin.
                   </p>

                 <li id="c1019">
                  <div class="cx" id="cx12784047">
                   <h5>
                    <a class="de">
                    </a>
                    <span class="cu">
                     Tagline..
                    </span>
                    <span class="crd ntb">
                     (
                     <a href="/comments/364689/12784047#c1019?mode=alone;showrate=1#c1019">
                      0+ / 0-
                     </a>
                     )
                    </span>
                   </h5>
                   <div class="ct">
                    <p>
                     intentionally screwy?
                    </p>
                    <p>
                     Original - 'you can lead a horse to water, but you can't make it drink'
                     <br/>
                     The Paraphrase by Dorothy Parkerm when challenged at a dinner party to use the word 'horticulture' in a sentence:
                    </p>
                    <p>
                     'You can lead a horticulture, but you can't make her think'.
                    </p>
                   </div>
                   <div class="cf">
                    <p class="sig">

                 <div class="ct">
                  <p>
                   Also because O'Reilly isn't only nasty, he's dangerous. Remember, he's now got the Secret Service monitoring his website for threats against Hillary, and I imagine for those terrorist threats too.
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   The way I see it, his show is actually an attempt to incite violence, and frankly, I blame Fox for putting him on more than I blame him for being a sociopath.
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   That being said, this bully needed to be confronted. Inevitably bullies tend to back down because they're all bluster and have no true strength.
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   This action seemed to be meant to throw some shit back in his face, and annoy him in the process. Since I see nothing in those signs that is meant to be more than just embarrassing, how is it over the top? I'm not understanding, especially since O'Reilly confronts other people in this manner as well.
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   And THIS will come back to haunt the reporter? Do you think that without this information the attacks would stop? Nope, especially since we're having such a good time tormenting him in these diaries.
                  </p>

                      <div class="ct">
                       <p>
                        Makris' name is in the public domain, and she received a settlement which in part accounts for this damage. She was forced into the public domain by BillO, not anyone else.
                       </p>
                       <p>
                        That there is a victim does not take this of the table. Far from it.
                       </p>
                       <p>
                        Look at it this way, every press report about BillO's behavior and the resulting settlement used the victim's name. When Makris bought a very expensive apartment, she was in the news. It IS legitimate news. It may be insensitive, but life is insensitive, and publishers far more polite than Stark have done their jobs on the topic without eruptions of outage on the pages of dKos.
                       </p>
                      </div>
                      <div class="cf">
                       <p class="sig">
                        <br/>
                        <a href="http://www.gropinator.net" rel="nofollow">
                         www.Gropinator.net
                        </a>
                       </p>
                       <p class="cb">
                        by
                        <a href="/user/uid:3116">
                         Pacific John
                        </a>
                        on
                        <a href="/comments/364689/12782681#c885">
                         Tue Jul 31, 2007 at 09:08:10 AM PDT
                        </a>
                       </p>
                       <p class="cl">
                        [
                        <a href="#c828">
                         Parent
                        </a>
                        ]
                       </p>
                      </div>
                     </div>
                    </li>

                      <div class="ct">
                       <p>
                        Exactly which press reports using Makris' name were gratuitous? Surely some were, but who can judge?
                       </p>
                       <p>
                        On the other hand, I see a clear argument in favor of Mike's judgment: he put a point on his message that made it hard to dismiss. The casual member of his audience would more easily dismiss the charge that O'Reilly is a sexual harasser unless there is a name to go with the charge.
                       </p>
                       <p>
                        This is the way people think. O'Reilly is a harasser? If he is, who did he harass? That's the very first question people have, and Mike answered it.
                       </p>

                          ticket punch
                         </a>
                        </dd>
                       </dl>
                      </div>
                      <div class="ct">
                       <p>
                        Harrassing O'Reilly at home is not a big powerful effective world-changing thing to do. It was dumb. We were responding to O'Reilly more effectively by exposing him and laughing at him, by pointing out his weakness &amp; inability to stop us, by satirizing him with a fake funeral, and by coming up with other tactics like an organized network to contacting local Fox advertisers when they get outrageous. We didn't need this wingnut tactic used by someone identified with DKos. It's not a "gun." Who is it going to win to our side? No one.
                       </p>
                       <p>
                        Some people already on the left will be amused; many will be turned off, and NO ONE will be won to our vision of the world.
                       </p>
                       <p>
                        So what was the point?
                       </p>
                      </div>
                      <div class="cf">
                       <p class="sig">
                       </p>

                 <li id="c454">
                  <div class="cx" id="cx12780847">
                   <h5>
                    <a class="de">
                    </a>
                    <span class="cu">
                     This is a problem
                    </span>
                    <span class="crd ntb">
                     (
                     <a href="/comments/364689/12780847#c454?mode=alone;showrate=1#c454">
                      11+ / 0-
                     </a>
                     )
                    </span>
                   </h5>
                   <div class="crs">
                    <dl>
                     <dt>
                      Recommended by:
                     </dt>
                     <dd>
                      <a href="/user/uid:4334">
                       teacherken
                      </a>
                      ,
                      <a href="/user/uid:6011">
                       DelRPCV
                      </a>
                      ,
                      <a href="/user/uid:20576">
                       Mary Julia
                      </a>
                      ,
                      <a href="/user/uid:28895">
                       revsue
                      </a>
                      ,
                      <a href="/user/uid:42316">
                       pontechango
                      </a>
                      ,
                      <a href="/user/uid:59002">
                       Sharon Jumper
                      </a>
                      ,
                      <a href="/user/uid:65877">
                       evanaj
                      </a>
                      ,
                      <a href="/user/uid:79484">
                       ticket punch
                      </a>
                      ,
                      <a href="/user/uid:116231">
                       Fiona West
                      </a>
                      ,
                      <a href="/user/uid:120707">
                       evora
                      </a>
                      ,
                      <a href="/user/uid:128110">
                       BlueGenes
                      </a>
                     </dd>
                    </dl>
                   </div>
                   <div class="ct">
                    <p>
                     Bill was never found liable in the sexual harassment suit, it settled out of court with no admission of liability by O'Reilly. There's a very strong argument that placing signs calling him a "pervert" and referencing the alleged (yes, that's what it is, he was never found liable) sexual harassment, is defamation. Pure and simple. I wrote an article once about a situation that I thought was an injustice, where parents who believed that their child had been molested by a neighbor started telling the other neighbors about the situation, wearing t-shirts, and placing signs asking the accused molester to leave. The parents were found liable for defamation (libel and slander), to the tune of several hundreds of thousands of dollars. Mike could face serious, and, frankly, legitimate trouble over this stunt.
                    </p>
                   </div>
                   <div class="cf">
                    <p class="sig">
                     Thought is only a flash in the middle of a long night, but the flash that means everything - Henri Poincar
                    </p>

                    <div class="ct">
                     <p>
                      ...if Bill sues for defamation, he has to show that Mike is lying. Mike should then be able to get a court order to get access to Mackris' phone-sex tape recordings (the source of the transcripts), and Bill would promptly lose the case. Which is why
                      <a href="http://www.google.com/search?hl=en&amp;safe=off&amp;q=mackris+o%27reilly&amp;btnG=Search">
                       sexual predator
                      </a>
                      and
                      <a href="http://www.google.com/search?hl=en&amp;q=site%3Awww.stormfront.org+%22o%27reilly%22">
                       white- supremacist icon
                      </a>
                      Bill O'Reilly will never sue.

                     <div class="cf">
                      <p class="sig">
                       <i>
                        Essential funk: 'Indictment' by
                        <a href="http://www.antibalas.com" rel="nofollow">
                         Antibalas

                       <p>
                        Truth is a
                        <em>
                         defense
                        </em>
                        . The burden of proving the defense is on the person asserting the defense (i.e., Mike Stark). Otherwise, calling someone a "pervert" is presumptively defamatory.
                       </p>

                         <a href="http://www.antibalas.com" rel="nofollow">

                    <li id="c1186">
                     <div class="cx" id="cx12786827">
                      <h5>
                       <a class="de">
                       </a>
                       <span class="cu">
                        And how would Billo clear this hurdle?
                       </span>
                       <span class="crd ntb">
                        (
                        <a href="/comments/364689/12786827#c1186?mode=alone;showrate=1#c1186">
                         0+ / 0-
                        </a>
                        )
                       </span>
                      </h5>
                      <div class="ct">
                       <p>
                        Finally, if the person being defamed is a public figure, the person being defamed must also prove that the statement was made with actual malice, i.e., the person making the statement not only knew it was false, but made it in reckless disregard of the truth. People considered public figures include any person who receives frequent media attention, or is well-known in a particular area.
                       </p>
                      </div>

                    </p>

                   </dd>
                  </dl>
                 </div>
                 <div class="ct">
                  <p>
                   O'Reilly does to his targets. He got the head of CNN fired for some innocuous comments for Christ's sake.
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   He goes after private citizens and and no-name college professors who don't toe his ideological line
                   <em>
                    and tries to ruin their lives and get them fired
                   </em>
                   . He knows that by airing their names on his show, he will bring his hordes down upon these poor unsuspecting citizens and subject them to harrassment and death threats.
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   But Mike Stark embarrassing Bill for one morning is apparently over the line. Give me a break.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                 <div class="cf">
                  <p class="sig">
                   Kakistocracy (noun): government by the most unscrupulous or unsuitable people, or a state governed by such people
                  </p>
                  <p class="cb">
                   by
                   <a href="/user/uid:35910">
                    cato

                   <a href="/comments/364689/12780635#c377">

               <ul class="cm i1" id="k12780635">
                <li id="c630">

                   <div class="ct">
                    <p>
                     ...but it's not my point. The point is that it's not true that 'real' journalists don't do it.
                    </p>
                    <p>
                     You might object to tempting anonymous people who might otherwise just have kept things in the realm of chat-room fantasy and very publicly exposing them.
                    </p>
                    <p>
                     But Bill did it out of his own volition, and repeatedly by his own admission in those transcripts -- from pressuring young women who work for him to have sex with him and then intimidating them to keep quiet, to paying for prostitutes in foreign countries.
                    </p>
                    <p>
                     And he still goes around shouting and hectoring us with lessons on morality and Catholicism, and writing books titled 'The Factor For Kids'.
                    </p>
                    <p>
                     It's very, very creepy.
                    </p>
                    <p>
                     On top of this, he lies with impunity on a daily basis. And the rest of the media treats him with respect, and journalists (even the same that approve of 'To Catch a Predator') treat him as an equal. It's repugnant beyond words. The DC political and media establishment is simply toxic, professionally and morally corrupt to the core.
                    </p>

                  I dont really care about Bill O...
                 </span>
                 <span class="crd ntb">

                   </a>
                   ,
                   <a href="/user/uid:51315">

                   </a>
                   ,
                   <a href="/user/uid:55258">

                   </a>

                   <a href="/user/uid:63264">

                   </a>

                   <a href="/user/uid:76169">

                   </a>
                   ,
                   <a href="/user/uid:77390">

                   </a>
                   ,
                   <a href="/user/uid:79887">
                    MarketTrustee
                   </a>
                   ,
                   <a href="/user/uid:96542">
                    Rabid Lambert
                   </a>
                   ,
                   <a href="/user/uid:105745">
                    wmholt
                   </a>
                   ,
                   <a href="/user/uid:105854">
                    Puffin
                   </a>
                  </dd>
                 </dl>
                </div>
                <div class="ct">
                 <p>
                  but I will say that I am sick of this attitude of "my way is the best way of discourse". FUCK THAT. I said in this diary that I would not have done what this dude did. Mainly because I dont give a shit enough to. But in the past I have gone to young republican meetings with army recruiting booklets and yelled pussy at all the guys opting not to enlist.
                 </p>
                 <p>
                  I am sick of this passive nature of Americans. Nobody cares what you
                  <strong>
                   think
                  </strong>
                  is the way to do shit. My advice to you is do your thing. But when I am letting the air out of tires with people who have a "W. Still the president" sicker on their car and leaving a note on the car that says I hope you think about all the kids that died in Iraq while you are waiting for someone to help you pump up your tire..... I really dont want to hear your opinion.
                 </p>
                 <p>
                  Every sucessful movement has had its peaceful side and its aggressive side. If you think the Civil Rights didnt have an aggressive side you are completely wrong. A lot of the success that MLK Jr. had came after many people saw the other movements that were gaining ground at the time. The same goes for Ghandi. You will find it incredibly hard to find any powerful movement that didnt have some branch of it stepping out and being, at least in some way, aggressive.
                 </p>
                </div>
                <div class="cf">
                 <p class="sig">
                 </p>
                 <p class="cb">
                  by
                  <a href="/user/uid:52222">
                   Hind2
                  </a>
                  on

                 <div class="ct">

                   re: the tire thing, you're screwing with people's livelihood, for exercising thir freedom of speech, I can't get behind that.
                  </p>
                  <p>
                   But I do agree with this sentence:
                  </p>
                  <blockquote>
                   <p>
                    Every sucessful movement has had its peaceful side and its aggressive side.
                   </p>
                  </blockquote>
                  <p>
                   We're not going to get anywhere by being all warm and fuzzy, all the time. I just think that whatever aggressive tactics we choose to use should stop short of causing real physical or economic harm to people. Let's just stick with making them uncomfortable and embarrassed.
                  </p>

                <ul class="cm i1" id="k12781309">
                 <li id="c900">
                  <div class="cx" id="cx12782810">
                   <h5>
                    <a class="de">
                    </a>
                    <span class="cu">
                     on "economic harm"
                    </span>
                    <span class="crd ntb">
                     (
                     <a href="/comments/364689/12782810#c900?mode=alone;showrate=1#c900">
                      1+ / 0-
                     </a>
                     )
                    </span>
                   </h5>
                   <div class="crs">
                    <dl>
                     <dt>
                      Recommended by:
                     </dt>
                     <dd>
                      <a href="/user/uid:181">
                       Rebecca
                      </a>
                     </dd>
                    </dl>
                   </div>
                   <div class="ct">
                    <p>
                     I don't think it's "economic harm" to convince people to stop giving our hard-earned money to people who are already rich to buy time to sell me more crap. Our media moguls and corporate overlords and their evil minions have enough money - Rupert Murdoch's not going to wind up on the streets because he didn't get that multi-million dollar ad deal, and neither is his mouthpiece Bill-O.
                    </p>
                    <p>
                     But it's indisputably harmful to prevent a working person from getting to their job by sabotaging their vehicle. That's where I part ways with the militant environmentalists who blow up people's SUVs (well, actually I part ways with them when they start making explosives in the first place, but you get my point).
                    </p>
                    <p>
                     So I suppose there's kind of a judgment call involved, but I think most people know where the line is.
                    </p>
                   </div>
                   <div class="cf">
                    <p class="sig">
                     We have never been at war with Eurasia. We have always been at war with Eastasia.
                    </p>

                 <h5>
                  <a class="de">
                  </a>
                  <span class="cu">
                   Kidding about what?
                  </span>
                  <span class="crd ntb">
                   (
                   <a href="/comments/364689/12797675#c1513?mode=alone;showrate=1#c1513">
                    0+ / 0-
                   </a>
                   )
                  </span>
                 </h5>
                 <div class="ct">
                  <p>
                   It was more than just not cool. Talking it what it isn't does not explain what it is. And for me to say it can't be tolerated doesn't say what the correct action is, IMHO. If I don't condemn the action you described, I am condoning it.
                   <br/>
                   I have to condemn this example of threatening language because it provides permission for others to push the envelop more in that direction which is the direction of violence. If you actually did do it then you engaged in vandalism and you deserved to be arrested as well as public scorn.
                  </p>
                 </div>
                 <div class="cf">
                  <p class="sig">

                  </a>

                 </p>

              <ul class="cm i1" id="k12792367">
               <li id="c1443">
                <div class="cx" id="cx12792447">

                  </span>

                 <div class="cf">
                  <p class="sig">
                   I'm just a simple hyperchicken from a backwoods asteroid.
                   <a href="http://www.clawjob.com" rel="nofollow">
                    Relentless!
                   </a>
                  </p>
                  <p class="cb">
                   by
                   <a href="/user/uid:13207">
                    ablington
                   </a>
                   on
                   <a href="/comments/364689/12792447#c1443">

            <li id="c836">
             <div class="cx" id="cx12782390">
              <h5>
               <a class="de">
               </a>
               <span class="cu">
                Actually I just got off the phone with
               </span>
               <span class="crd ntb">
                (
                <a href="/comments/364689/12782390#c836?mode=alone;showrate=1#c836">
                 8+ / 0-
                </a>
                )
               </span>
              </h5>
              <div class="crs">
               <dl>
                <dt>
                 Recommended by:
                </dt>
                <dd>
                 <a href="/user/uid:181">
                  Rebecca
                 </a>
                 ,
                 <a href="/user/uid:24125">
                  moiv
                 </a>
                 ,
                 <a href="/user/uid:41104">
                  bablhous
                 </a>
                 ,
                 <a href="/user/uid:77390">
                  Horsehead
                 </a>
                 ,
                 <a href="/user/uid:79887">
                  MarketTrustee
                 </a>
                 ,
                 <a href="/user/uid:87707">
                  Susan Something
                 </a>
                 ,
                 <a href="/user/uid:118795">
                  Mother of Zeus
                 </a>
                 ,
                 <a href="/user/uid:120707">
                  evora
                 </a>
                </dd>
               </dl>
              </div>
              <div class="ct">
               <p>
                Estevan at Harry Reid's office. I had a very revealing conversation with him. Now understand, he is just the guy who answers the phone for the Majority Leader's office. His name is Estevan, which he didn't want to reveal... so don't complain too much about billo and his BS.
               </p>
               <p>
                There is BS coming from Harry's office too.
               </p>
               <ul>
                <li>
                 I referred to the statements of May 20, 2007 that the press released about him being tough on Bush and tough on whatever needs to be done to stop the war!
                </li>
                <li>
                 I asked if they were keeping the Senate open to block Bush from making recess appointments.
                </li>
                <li>
                 Estevan didn't know. I asked him who knew. He said he didn't know. He said, "We haven't heard anything, but we've been getting a lot of calls in the last two days."
                </li>
                <li>
                 I told him I'm a Dem and that I've been a Dem since the day I turned 18 and voted for the first time. I told him I'm very angry at Harry and Nancy. I told him that I'm not giving another penny to a Dem until Harry and Nancy do something bold, brave and thoughtful by carrying out the oath's they swore to when they were sworn in.
                </li>
                <li>
                 I told him that there is
                 <strong>
                  NO WAY
                 </strong>
                 other than
                 <ins>
                  IMPEACHMENT
                 </ins>
                 to stop the war, stop the illegal and unconstituational politicization and rape of the US Constitution in every department of the US government now that we know he won't send Gonzo back to TX and now that we know that he has already planned the continuation of the occupation of Iraq until 2009!
                </li>
                <li>
                 And I told him that I thought that the Senator original thought about how he could stop recess appointments was a good one, but that I could see from his inability to tell me what's going on with the plan that Harry's planning abilities are likely as poor as the Bush plan for Iraq.
                </li>
                <li>
                 I asked him to find out what's going on. His answer was, "Well mam, call back tomorrow and I'll try to have some inforamtion for you."
                </li>
               </ul>
               <p>
                In other words, go to hell lady. We will do what we want without your input. This is no longer a democracy we live in. George Bush created this and Harry Reid and Nancy Pelosi, the only two people who can do something about it are too weak, afraid, worried about the future to the degree that they can't live in or act on inforamtion they have right now!
               </p>
               <p>
                Finally, he left me with the feeling that there was no hope other than for all of us to retreat and to do something different. Right now I have no idea what that is, but I'd like us to let them know without doubt that their inability to act decisively is going to cause mass exedous of people like us from the ranks of the Democratic Party.
               </p>
               <p>
                And before I called Harry, I gave a call to Nancy and left some comments there.
               </p>
               <p>
                So I did something, but I sure don't feel good about the outcome of my actions.
               </p>
              </div>

               <p class="sig">

                </a>
                ,
                <a href="/user/uid:61876">
                 Casper46
                </a>
                ,
                <a href="/user/uid:63264">
                 viscerality
                </a>
                ,
                <a href="/user/uid:74968">
                 Data Pimp
                </a>
                ,
                <a href="/user/uid:75329">
                 JVolvo
                </a>
                ,
                <a href="/user/uid:77390">
                 Horsehead
                </a>
                ,
                <a href="/user/uid:89713">
                 TrueBlueCT
                </a>
                ,
                <a href="/user/uid:96542">
                 Rabid Lambert
                </a>
                ,
                <a href="/user/uid:105745">
                 wmholt
                </a>
                ,
                <a href="/user/uid:123198">
                 Buffalo Nickel
                </a>
               </dd>
              </dl>
             </div>
             <div class="ct">
              <p>
               Poor Judgment? What a joke. Anyone who could make such an incredible statement should take a deep breath and look around. How has the current political landscape gotten so ugly? How does a guy like Bill O get on the tube each night and spin hate with impunity? Maybe these guys feel invulnerable...they sure act that way!
               <br/>
               The fact is, we're in an ugly fight with some very mean people. When you fight a bully there's no way to keep it clean and if you truly want to confront the problem, you roll your sleeves up and take it on, regardless of anything else. Do you think right-wing liars would spew the hate and lies they do if people were actively confronting them? There's room for everybody in this fight for the nation, but anyone who criticizes Mr. Stark should rethink their position. We're in a war, folks, and we're fighting for a smarter, more compassionate government, not to mention a better world. Our foes live in the mud, we're going to get dirty if we are willing to fight. We'll never beat this group with charm-school etiquette since they are willing to ANYTHING.
               <br/>
               Mr. Mike Stark used bad judgment in confronting a bully with a dose of his own medicine? What a joke.
               <br/>
               Give me a hundred Mike Starks and we'll destroy the Republican party......which is a good thing. They're not conservative and they are not responsible guardians of the nation's safety so what do they really stand for? From where I sit, I see nothing but a treasonous bunch of elitists hell-bent on preserving the entitlement they all believe they are due. Wake up.
              </p>
             </div>

            </div>
            <div class="ct">
             <p>
              Anybody who traffics in the "politics of personal destruction" ought to get a generous helping of his own dish served up to him. If O'Reilly thinks we're a hate site, he ain't seen nothing yet.
             </p>
             <p>
              Kudos to Mide for having the cojones to take the fight to Bill-O. He's used to having all the control, cutting mikes and shouting down opponents. It's time he realized that his tactics have consequences.
             </p>
             <p>
              We are too timid and scrupulous at our own peril. Bravo again, Mike!
             </p>
            </div>
            <div class="cf">

              <h5>
               <a class="de">
               </a>
               <span class="cu">
                TXsharon
               </span>
               <span class="crd ntb">
                (
                <a href="/comments/364689/12790347#c1355?mode=alone;showrate=1#c1355">
                 3+ / 0-
                </a>

               </span>
              </h5>
              <div class="crs">
               <dl>
                <dt>
                 Recommended by:
                </dt>
                <dd>
                 <a href="/user/uid:10625">
                  San Francisco Liberal
                 </a>
                 ,
                 <a href="/user/uid:31366">
                  Dallasdoc
                 </a>
                 ,
                 <a href="/user/uid:80159">
                  DonMahoney
                 </a>
                </dd>
               </dl>
              </div>
              <div class="ct">
               <p>
                Thanks for the off-ramp from the hand-wringing upstairs.
               </p>
               <p>
                Kudos to Mike for a well deserved confrontation interview with a subject worthy of the approach.
               </p>
               <p>
                Complaining about Mike Stark questioning BillO in confrontational terms reminds me of George Bush complaining about David Gregory questioning French President Chirac in French. Stark was speaking the language of the person being interviewed and Mike Stark should be commended for his cultural sensitivity.
               </p>
               <p>
                This was brilliant, warranted and downright fun.
               </p>
              </div>

                </a>
