                <a href="/user/uid:75329">
                 JVolvo
                </a>
                ,
                <a href="/user/uid:76550">
                 dirtfarmer
                </a>
                ,
                <a href="/user/uid:79015">
                 Clive all hat no horse Rodeo
                </a>
                ,
                <a href="/user/uid:89235">
                 Haningchadus14
                </a>
                ,
                <a href="/user/uid:89551">
                 Cat Whisperer
                </a>
                ,
                <a href="/user/uid:95159">
                 DvCM
                </a>
                ,
                <a href="/user/uid:101902">
                 davefromqueens
                </a>
                ,
                <a href="/user/uid:106912">
                 MichiganGirl
                </a>
                ,
                <a href="/user/uid:122839">
                 kyril
                </a>
                ,
                <a href="/user/uid:123198">
                 Buffalo Nickel
                </a>
                ,
                <a href="/user/uid:124269">
                 o the umanity
                </a>
               </dd>
              </dl>
             </div>
             <div class="ct">
              <p>
               I normally take the high road in everything I do.
              </p>
              <p>
               But I've read all the concerns from other members commenting here about us sinking to his level, and this situation is different. It's one thing if an
               <strong>
                honorable
               </strong>
               opponent states his case and you disagree with it and counter with your own. But nothing about Billo is honorable. He lies, he threatens, he harrasses. He is not worthy of the same gentle-handed rebuttals.
              </p>
              <blockquote>
               <p>
                Dallasdoc:
                <br/>
                We are too timid and scrupulous at our own peril
               </p>
              </blockquote>
              <p>
               .
              </p>
              <p>
               This time I totally agree. I can live with respectful and honorable opponents from the other side of the aisle. But vicious, vindictive jerks like Billo need to be exposed with their own hypocritical actions. No sympathy here.
               <br/>
               Muffy
              </p>
             </div>

             <div class="ct">
              <p>
               So much of politics is theater--very, very bad theater.
              </p>
              <p>
               In the form of soundbites and lies--outright lies.
              </p>
              <p>
               This morning Mr. Giuliani is calling Senator Clinton's health plan--which she hasn't even fucking announced--socialized medicine. And, even worse, Mr. Giuliani is calling it the Clinton/Moore (as in Michael) health care.
              </p>
              <p>
               This is a lying sound bite. It is also very bad theater.
              </p>
              <p>
               Which bring me to Mike Stark. Mike has balls. Mike is brave.
              </p>
              <p>
               The problem that Mike will now find himself in is that it will give O'Reilly more of his nonsense talking points.
               <del>
                Mike
               </del>
               all of us will have to engage in hand to hand combat with Fox news and their unique brand of lying fools.
              </p>
              <p>
               Fox News will be in battling mode in Chicago. We better be ready for these motherfuckers.
              </p>
             </div>

               <blockquote>
                <p>
                 In France, the government is afraid of the people. In the US, people are afraid of the government.
                </p>
               </blockquote>
               <p>
                The government should be afraid of us. So should all power elites, most especially the "amoral and dishonest water carriers" in the media (as Olbermann called Brit Hume last night.)
               </p>
               <p>
                <em>
                 Aux armes, citoyens!
                </em>
               </p>
              </div>
              <div class="cf">
               <p class="sig">
                Prematurely anti-Bush since 1999.
               </p>
               <p class="cb">
                by
                <a href="/user/uid:31366">
                 Dallasdoc
                </a>

                <a href="/comments/364689/12780777#c428">

               <div class="ct">
                <blockquote>
                 <p>
                  The government should be afraid of us. So should all power elites, most especially the "amoral and dishonest water carriers" in the media (as Olbermann called Brit Hume last night.)
                 </p>
                </blockquote>
                <p>
                 I agree DD... right now our government doesn't give a damn about us and they are not going to listen without some kind of bold action on our part.
                </p>
                <p>
                 Not only the White House doesn't care about anything except covering their own illegal actions. Unfortunately, the list of people who don't give a damn about what we say includes the leaders in the House and Senate. But what does this billo thing with Mike have to do with the current state of the government of the United States?
                </p>
               </div>

          <li id="c1522">
           <div class="cx" id="cx12798504">
            <h5>
             <a class="de">
             </a>
             <span class="cu">
              Clear something up for me
             </span>
             <span class="crd ntb">
              (
              <a href="/comments/364689/12798504#c1522?mode=alone;showrate=1#c1522">
               0+ / 0-
              </a>
              )
             </span>
            </h5>
            <div class="ct">
             Since when did we start subscribing to the Wingnut Saturday Morning Matinee morality that every conflict must be good vs evil?
             <p>
              What you did was just a lesser degree of evil. If that's where you need to sink to to fight O'Reilly, then he's already won.
             </p>
            </div>
            <div class="cf">
             <p class="sig">
              --
             </p>

              <p>
               Absolutely agree. However, Mike Stark cannot change billo no matter how he much he exposes the truth.
              </p>
              <p>
               Mike Stark's actions could cause big time problems for Kos, DK and YK. And further, Mike Stark doesn't necessarily speak for Kos, DK and YK... and he needs to make that known. Why? Because billo is who he is, you know he will not take Mike's actions lightly. He will grab on to us like a pit bull... and even though he is all of the things Mike said he is (and everything all of us agree with), there could be consequences that may be very damaging to the image Kos has worked hard to create with this site. Although I agree 100% with Mike, I didn't give him permission to speak for me and neither did Kos give him permission to speak to for him or the site. That is my only concern about what he did.

           <div class="ct">
            <p>
             ...would be slinging dog shit at billo's house. or doing some work with spray paint.
            </p>
            <p>
             people who oppose mike stark's actions are mistakenly equating physical, destructive intimidation (e.g. abortion clinic protestors and the fred phelps clan) with edgey journalistic activism (e.g. Michael Moore films).
            </p>
           </div>
           <div class="cf">
            <p class="sig">
            </p>
            <p class="cb">
             by
             <a href="/user/uid:9197">

             </a>

         </li>
         <li id="c1094">
          <div class="cx" id="cx12784946">
           <h5>
            <a class="de">
            </a>
            <span class="cu">
             While I take no position regarding this diary, it
            </span>
            <span class="crd ntb">
             (
             <a href="/comments/364689/12784946#c1094?mode=alone;showrate=1#c1094">
              9+ / 0-
             </a>
             )
            </span>
           </h5>
           <div class="crs">
            <dl>
             <dt>
              Recommended by:
             </dt>
             <dd>
              <a href="/user/uid:3930">
               vivacia
              </a>
              ,
              <a href="/user/uid:10625">
               San Francisco Liberal
              </a>
              ,
              <a href="/user/uid:49715">
               Chinton
              </a>
              ,
              <a href="/user/uid:61876">
               Casper46
              </a>
              ,
              <a href="/user/uid:65556">
               FrankFrink
              </a>
              ,
              <a href="/user/uid:74968">
               Data Pimp
              </a>
              ,
              <a href="/user/uid:77390">
               Horsehead
              </a>
              ,
              <a href="/user/uid:104129">
               rrheard
              </a>
              ,
              <a href="/user/uid:112640">
               Unbill
              </a>
             </dd>
            </dl>
           </div>
           <div class="ct">
            <p>
             got me thinking that I seem to recall something about o'liely stalking a media person. After some time on the tubes, I found this
            </p>
            <blockquote>
             <p>
              Stalk Market
              <br/>
              If journalists condemn Bill O'Reilly, he'll strike back anytime and anywhere -- even in the parking lot of a local Wild Oats
             </p>
            </blockquote>
            <blockquote>
             <p>
              Still, these dustups were minor in comparison to O'Reilly's treatment of Post media expert Joanne Ostrow. On April 7, she wrote an online piece chiding O'Reilly for spewing "racist bile" in an epic blowup with fellow Fox personality Geraldo Rivera. (O'Reilly and Rivera had harangued each other over a March 30 Virginia Beach crash in which two young women were reportedly killed by Alfredo Ramos, a drunk driver with a previous record and no green card. The former viewed the tragedy as an indictment of U.S. immigration policy; the latter argued against using the deaths to make a "cheap political point.") Two days later, O'Reilly put Ostrow in the "Ridiculous" spotlight, branding her "flat-out dishonest, and a far-left ideologue." In the meantime, O'Reilly producer Porter Berry phoned to ask if Ostrow would debate her statements on the Factor; she declined, saying her prose spoke for itself.
              <strong>
               Then, on April 10, Berry, a cameraman and a sound technician ambushed Ostrow in the parking lot of a Wild Oats market. (Berry flew in for the task.)
              </strong>
              On April 11, O'Reilly aired this forced conversation on his nationally syndicated radio staple and the television Factor.
             </p>
             <p>
              Although KOA's Mike Rosen and KHOW's Peter Boyles scoffed at the notion that
              <strong>
               Ostrow had been stalked, her experiences imply otherwise. Since she went directly from her home to Wild Oats, Ostrow believes Berry staked out her residence and tailed her to the business.
              </strong>
              "The saving grace was that I wasn't picking up my daughter," she allows.
             </p>
             <p>
              What does Berry say to Ostrow's assertions? Zip -- and his silence comes with a serving of irony. When reached on April 16, he claimed he couldn't speak without permission from Fox News's media-relations branch. "I'll do anything they tell me," he maintained. Requests to interview both Berry and O'Reilly were then submitted to a Fox spokeswoman, who phoned back to say, "We're going to take a pass." Was it hypocritical for the two men to criticize Ostrow for not standing up for her actions when they rebuffed inquiries about theirs? The spokeswoman didn't retort on the record -- but she did request that her name not be printed. (No problem, ma'am. Happy to preserve your deniability.)
             </p>
             <p>
              The next day, Berry agreed to personally ask the spokeswoman for permission to speak. He apparently got nowhere, and an e-mail to O'Reilly went unanswered.
             </p>
             <p>
              <a href="http://www.westword.com/2007-04-19/news/stalk-market/full">
               April 19, 2007 Westword
              </a>
              <br/>
              Emphasis Added
             </p>
            </blockquote>
            <p>
             O'liely and his minions have a well established pattern and history of doing what Mike did. While you may agree or disagree, by billos actions, it was not unprecedented.
            </p>
           </div>
           <div class="cf">
            <p class="sig">
             It is the province of knowledge to speak
And it is the privilege of wisdom to listen.  
Oliver Wendell Holmes Jr.      
US Jurist
            </p>
            <p class="cb">
             by
             <a href="/user/uid:119570">
              Oliver W Holmes the 3rd
             </a>
             on
             <a href="/comments/364689/12784946#c1094">
              Tue Jul 31, 2007 at 10:35:39 AM PDT
             </a>
            </p>

               You're much closer to trolling than he is.

            <div class="cx" id="cx12779704">
             <h5>
              <a class="de">
              </a>
              <span class="cu">
               But that's the point
              </span>
              <span class="crd ntb">
               (
               <a href="/comments/364689/12779704#c70?mode=alone;showrate=1#c70">

                    <em>

                    tactics is hardly the way to hold the moral high ground.                    </p>

                  <div class="cf">
                   <p class="sig">
                    Just call their form of government Hypocracy.
                   </p>
                   <p class="cb">
                    by
                    <a href="/user/uid:118312">
                     lineatus
                    </a>
                    on
                    <a href="/comments/364689/12780329#c259">

                </li>
                <ul class="cm i1" id="k12780329">
                 <li id="c325">
                  <div class="cx" id="cx12780499">
                   <h5>
                    <a class="de">
                    </a>
                    <span class="cu">
                     Agreed
                    </span>
                    <span class="crd ntb">
                     (
                     <a href="/comments/364689/12780499#c325?mode=alone;showrate=1#c325">
                      13+ / 0-
                     </a>
                     )
                    </span>
                   </h5>
                   <div class="crs">
                    <dl>
                     <dt>
                      Recommended by:
                     </dt>
                     <dd>
                      <a href="/user/uid:181">
                       Rebecca
                      </a>
                      ,
                      <a href="/user/uid:1231">
                       sj
                      </a>
                      ,
                      <a href="/user/uid:20555">
                       mint julep
                      </a>
                      ,
                      <a href="/user/uid:33525">
                       Builderman
                      </a>
                      ,
                      <a href="/user/uid:41104">
                       bablhous
                      </a>
                      ,
                      <a href="/user/uid:44069">
                       rapala
                      </a>
                      ,
                      <a href="/user/uid:46027">
                       pattyp
                      </a>
                      ,
                      <a href="/user/uid:52027">
                       Hibernian
                      </a>
                      ,
                      <a href="/user/uid:61986">
                       Team Slacker
                      </a>
                      ,
                      <a href="/user/uid:67221">
                       MuffledDrum
                      </a>
                      ,
                      <a href="/user/uid:104129">
                       rrheard
                      </a>
                      ,
                      <a href="/user/uid:117930">
                       Bipolar Disorder Democrat
                      </a>
                      ,
                      <a href="/user/uid:122839">
                       kyril
                      </a>
                     </dd>
                    </dl>
                   </div>
                   <div class="ct">
                    <p>
                     It's wonderful that Mike did what he did, and I totally support your right to voice disagreement about it. Hell, I even support Billo's right to come out and distort the entire thing tonight by calling it a "DKos stalking" or whatever the hell he calls it. In the end, I'm supremely confident that the facts will speak for themselves, and a gasbag like O'Reilly ultimately does himself in just by opening his mouth.
                    </p>
                    <p>
                     That's why free speech is such a beautiful thing: it lets the morons expose themselves without any help from us at all. The only people who will think ill of DKos are the O'Reilly wing of the GOP. We've already lost them, so who cares?
                    </p>
                   </div>
                   <div class="cf">
                    <p class="sig">
                    </p>
                    <p class="cb">
                     by
                     <a href="/user/uid:15060">
                      rlamoureux
                     </a>
                     on
                     <a href="/comments/364689/12780499#c325">
                      Tue Jul 31, 2007 at 07:34:53 AM PDT
                     </a>
                    </p>
                    <p class="cl">
                     [
                     <a href="#c259">
                      Parent
                     </a>
                     ]

                  <div class="ct">
                   <p>
                    Fine, there is nothing wrong with that, but that isn't what so many people here seemed to be worried about. They are afraid that they and the rest of the site will be lumped in with Mike. The point rlamoureux is making is that this concern is unwarranted. Anything anyone posts here can be used to say the DK community as a whole supports something.
                   </p>
                   <p>
                    BillO will undoubtedly do just that with this post. However, the has already done this a number of times with other posts.
                   </p>
                   <p>
                    If you disagree with Mike that is fine and you are free to argue the point with people who disagree but rlamoureux's analogy actually holds quite well. It may not adress your concerns but then again it wasn't meant to. It was meant to address the concerns of those who are afraid of BillO saying the DK community is stalking him.

              <h5>
               <a class="de">
               </a>
               <span class="cu">
                I HATE what BO is trying to do to my country.
               </span>
               <span class="crd ntb">
                (
                <a href="/comments/364689/12780522#c337?mode=alone;showrate=1#c337">
                 11+ / 0-
                </a>
                )
               </span>
              </h5>
              <div class="crs">
               <dl>
                <dt>
                 Recommended by:
                </dt>
                <dd>
                 <a href="/user/uid:181">
                  Rebecca
                 </a>
                 ,
                 <a href="/user/uid:1231">
                  sj
                 </a>
                 ,
                 <a href="/user/uid:18993">
                  Xeno of Elia
                 </a>
                 ,
                 <a href="/user/uid:36004">
                  betson08
                 </a>
                 ,
                 <a href="/user/uid:41104">
                  bablhous
                 </a>
                 ,
                 <a href="/user/uid:44069">
                  rapala
                 </a>
                 ,
                 <a href="/user/uid:67221">
                  MuffledDrum
                 </a>
                 ,
                 <a href="/user/uid:85984">
                  Noor B
                 </a>
                 ,
                 <a href="/user/uid:101902">
                  davefromqueens
                 </a>
                 ,
                 <a href="/user/uid:104129">
                  rrheard
                 </a>
                 ,
                 <a href="/user/uid:122839">
                  kyril
                 </a>
                </dd>
               </dl>
              </div>
              <div class="ct">
               <p>
                I think we all HATE it. I HATE the fact that he depends on, and exploits our natural desire for calm, respectful discourse in order to avoid being exposed. I HATE the fact that he continues spewing dangerous lies and mind-altering propaganda into peoples homes on a daily basis, w/o being publically confronted. And I really HATE the fact that he has so many people quivering in abject fear and confusion about wether or not its appropriate to TELL THE TRUTH (in front of his neighbors....Oh my).
               </p>
              </div>
              <div class="cf">
               <p class="sig">
                "Fear not the path of truth for the lack of people 
walking on it." Robert F. Kennedy

June 6th, 1968
               </p>
               <p class="cb">
                by
                <a href="/user/uid:27417">

                </a>

                <a href="/comments/364689/12780522#c337">

             <div class="cf">
              <p class="sig">

              </p>
              <p class="cb">
               by
               <a href="/user/uid:16376">

             </div>
            </div>
           </li>
           <ul class="cm i1" id="k12779686">
            <li id="c1140">
             <div class="cx" id="cx12785721">
              <h5>
               <a class="de">
               </a>
               <span class="cu">
                Tough one
               </span>
               <span class="crd ntb">
                (
                <a href="/comments/364689/12785721#c1140?mode=alone;showrate=1#c1140">
                 2+ / 0-
                </a>
                )
               </span>
              </h5>
              <div class="crs">
               <dl>
                <dt>
                 Recommended by:
                </dt>
                <dd>
                 <a href="/user/uid:34397">
                  Caldonia
                 </a>
                 ,
                 <a href="/user/uid:106480">
                  Quanta
                 </a>
                </dd>
               </dl>
              </div>
              <div class="ct">
               <p>
                I'm torn too. I don't agree with invading the privacy of someone's home or neighborhood. Yet the "honk" demonstrations on the street in front of Mitch McConnell's house didn't seem that out of bounds. Which seems contradictory.
               </p>
               <p>
                I know what it takes to fight bullies like O'Reilly after a certain point, I think it's the best way to deal with them. O'Reilly qualifies.
               </p>
               <p>
                It will be interesting to see how he reacts to getting some of his own medicine. Will it suddenly be an outrage to do to him what he has done to others?
               </p>
               <p>
                Still, I feel like it could have been done by going to his office, or some other way than going to his home. I would have been perfectly fine with confronting him anywhere other than his home (or somewhere in public with his kids, let's say.) So I agree with Mike in principle and I think fighting back is the thing to do, but the tactics used crossed the line for me.
               </p>
              </div>
              <div class="cf">
               <p class="sig">
                "So, you have a choice: be a fighting liberal or sit quietly. I know what I am, what are you?" -- Steve Gilliard
               </p>
               <p class="cb">
                by
                <a href="/user/uid:44591">
                 joanneleon
                </a>
                on
                <a href="/comments/364689/12785721#c1140">
                 Tue Jul 31, 2007 at 11:11:26 AM PDT
                </a>
               </p>
               <p class="cl">
                [
                <a href="#c63">
                 Parent
                </a>
                ]
               </p>
              </div>
             </div>
            </li>
            <ul class="cm i1" id="k12785721">
             <li id="c1382">
              <div class="cx" id="cx12790872">
               <h5>
                <a class="de">
                </a>
                <span class="cu">
                 I agree with you guys
                </span>
                <span class="crd ntb">
                 (
                 <a href="/comments/364689/12790872#c1382?mode=alone;showrate=1#c1382">
                  0+ / 0-
                 </a>
                 )
                </span>
               </h5>
               <div class="ct">
                <p>
                 Under normal conditions I find what Mike did to be appauling. Nor do I generally agree with stooping to the other people's level, and who knows, holding true to that ideal may have been the better thing to do. However, with that said, in this case it was worth it.
                </p>
                <p>
                 There is just so much poetic justice in what Mike did to BillO. I am not a proponent of an eye for an eye and what Mike did is hardly an eye for an eye. If you wanted an eye for an eye you'd have to do something much worse to O'reilly and do it repeatedly. What Mike has done here is to give BillO just the smallest taste, the slightest sip, of his own medicine.
                </p>
                <p>
                 If you asked me if I'd recomend doing this again, the answer is no. We should not make a habit of using their tactics, and a joke is never as funny the second time you hear it. To do this again any time in the near future would be wrong for the action would have lost its luster, its sense of poetic justice.
                </p>
                <p>
                 Our weapons are better than theirs anyway. We are armed with civil discourse, the best tool for assisting truth, our ally. Further, we are armed with satire and irony, our best weapon against hypocracy and lies.
                </p>
                <p>
                 Some here believe that if we support Mike's actions and criticize O'reilly's actions we are hypocrits. I contend that this is not so. What O'reilly did was harasment; what Mike did is ironic. The serpant O'reilly spreading his vile venom gets to enjoy the bitter pungent flavor of his own concoction. If this is as far as Mike plans to go, which I believe it is, then there is no hypocracy.
                </p>
               </div>
               <div class="cf">
                <p class="sig">
                 "It was believed afterward that the man was a lunatic, because there was no sense in what he said."  "The War Prayer" by Mark Twain
                </p>
                <p class="cb">
                 by
                 <a href="/user/uid:106480">
                  Quanta
                 </a>
                 on
                 <a href="/comments/364689/12790872#c1382">
                  Tue Jul 31, 2007 at 04:01:29 PM PDT
                 </a>
                </p>
                <p class="cl">
                 [
                 <a href="#c1140">
                  Parent
                 </a>
                 ]
                </p>
               </div>
              </div>
             </li>
            </ul>
           </ul>
           <li id="c66">
            <div class="cx" id="cx12779694">
             <h5>

              <p>
               I'm sure he'll be on the air tonight talking about how "the far-left hate site, dailykos.com, is now stalking me at my home." You don't have to do his work for him by attaching every member of this site to the actions of one person. Looks to me like a.) the posters are divided on whether this was a good idea, and b.) in any case, Mike was not doing this under the "official" auspices of the site.
              </p>
              <p>
               Either way, don't start beating the drums about how "by proxy" we are all part of this.

              </p>
              <p>

              </p>
              <p>

              </p>
              <p>
               Politely knock on Billo's door and ask for interview - no problem.
              </p>

               Notify cops that perhaps he should be on the sex offenders registry - no problem.
              </p>

               Putting up signs in his neighborhood - possible problem (did you get the neighbors' permission?)
              </p>

              </p>

           <li id="c1387">
            <div class="cx" id="cx12790911">
             <h5>
              <a class="de">
              </a>
              <span class="cu">
               yeah
              </span>
              <span class="crd ntb">
               (
               <a href="/comments/364689/12790911#c1387?mode=alone;showrate=1#c1387">
                0+ / 0-
               </a>
               )
              </span>
             </h5>
             <div class="ct">
              <p>
               blogs like dailykos are here to replace the MSM, and to do that we're going to have to act like it.
              </p>
              <p>
               you can't put up signs full of truthiness, you have to play neutral, you have to be fair, even if they are not.
              </p>
              <p>
               hell, I'm not saying totally fair, you have to play hardball too, but you don't flaunt your immaturity and expect to be the modern version of the "Paper of Record"... er, "Blog of Record".
              </p>
              <p>
               I don't think kos needs this sort of help, mike should not do this sort of stunt, or take it elsewhere... maybe Michael Moore's site, if he has one.
              </p>

           <div class="cx" id="cx12780498">
            <h5>
             <a class="de">
             </a>
             <span class="cu">
              You've been watching too many movies.
             </span>
             <span class="crd ntb">
              (
              <a href="/comments/364689/12780498#c324?mode=alone;showrate=1#c324">
               3+ / 0-
              </a>
              )
             </span>
            </h5>
            <div class="crs">
             <dl>
              <dt>
               Recommended by:
              </dt>
              <dd>
               <a href="/user/uid:9240">
                Yoshimi
               </a>
               ,
               <a href="/user/uid:44069">
                rapala
               </a>
               ,
               <a href="/user/uid:122839">
                kyril
               </a>
              </dd>
             </dl>
            </div>
            <div class="ct">
             <p>
              In real life, after the "scrawny" kid bloodies the "bully's" nose, Bully beats the shit out of Scrawny.
             </p>
             <p>
              I'm not trying to say anything good about O'Reilly, a bully is a bully. I'm just trying to disabuse you of the common myth that all bullies back down if their victims stand up to them. Most often they don't. Most bullies only back down, if they are smart(and many aren't), to superior force. In other words, weak scrawny guys only have a chance of prevailing if they band together.
             </p>
            </div>
            <div class="cf">

           <h5>
            <a class="de">
            </a>
            <span class="cu">
             this is true but....
            </span>
            <span class="crd ntb">
             (
             <a href="/comments/364689/12779702#c69?mode=alone;showrate=1#c69">
              24+ / 0-
             </a>

            </span>
           </h5>
           <div class="crs">
            <dl>
             <dt>

               baccaruda
              </a>
              ,
              <a href="/user/uid:51535">
               frandor55
              </a>
              ,
              <a href="/user/uid:54433">
               boofdah
              </a>
              ,
              <a href="/user/uid:57345">
               Robert in WV
              </a>
              ,
              <a href="/user/uid:59478">
               newfie53523
              </a>
              ,
              <a href="/user/uid:60262">
               Five Thirty
              </a>
              ,
              <a href="/user/uid:73734">
               Lashe
              </a>
              ,
              <a href="/user/uid:75492">
               Dauphin
              </a>
              ,
              <a href="/user/uid:77002">
               SplishSplash
              </a>
              ,
              <a href="/user/uid:86626">
               dotdot
              </a>
              ,
              <a href="/user/uid:110850">
               AJsMom
              </a>
              ,
              <a href="/user/uid:111341">
               AnnieJo
              </a>
              ,
              <a href="/user/uid:118312">
               lineatus
              </a>
              ,
              <a href="/user/uid:121222">
               TDE
              </a>
             </dd>
            </dl>
           </div>
           <div class="ct">
            <p>
             With all due respect to Mike Stark and the balls he has shown on a national scale, I don't like this one bit.....knocking on the doors of the neighbors and giving them copies of a public record are fine in my opninion, placing signs on people's lawn with permission that vilify a neighbor is also ok, but ambushing a person in their driveway is unacceptable and can meet the elements of stalking in certain states, even if the intent is only to annoy or harass (duh). Mike didn't trespass as people are allowed to walk up a driveway of a private residence in order to ring the bell, knock, etc, but what Mike did very well may open him to criminal charges (not necessarily conviction, but charges).
            </p>
            <p>
             In my opninion, Mike should have stuck with the block walking campaign of giving out the documents to the neighbors and let O'Reilly keep ranting, he's doing enough damage to himself on his own, he really doesn't need help like this.
            </p>
            <p>
             Mike, as a future member of the bar, you are better than this.....keep in mind that our profession demands integrity and cheap stunts give credibility to accusations of abulance chasing and being greedy trial lawyers from the likes of Robert Novak. You may not care, but I do.
            </p>
           </div>
           <div class="cf">
            <p class="sig">
             Proud to be a Red County, Texas Democrat!

           <div class="cx" id="cx12780360">
            <h5>
             <a class="de">
             </a>
             <span class="cu">
              With reagrd to the trespass
             </span>
             <span class="crd ntb">
              (
              <a href="/comments/364689/12780360#c270?mode=alone;showrate=1#c270">
               0+ / 0-
              </a>
              )
             </span>
            </h5>
            <div class="ct">
             <p>
              It might very well be criminal trespass if the person in question walked up the driveway and rang the doorbell with a turned-on video camera in his or her hand in order to record the encounter.
             </p>
             <p>
              Not a 'concern' guy here...except for Mike, but I assume he has access to legal advice, if necessary. He might also consider that, if going for admission to NY Bar, this incident might put a hiccup in his character committee review. It shouldn't DQ him, but he just should be aware of it.
             </p>
            </div>

               <a href="/user/uid:77390">
                Horsehead
               </a>
               ,
               <a href="/user/uid:79015">
                Clive all hat no horse Rodeo
               </a>
               ,
               <a href="/user/uid:101902">
                davefromqueens
               </a>
               ,
               <a href="/user/uid:104129">
                rrheard
               </a>
              </dd>
             </dl>
            </div>
            <div class="ct">
             <p>
              you would just stand there and let them hit you because you think fighting is "stooping to their level"?
             </p>
             <p>
              I view it as an invitation to fight back.
             </p>
             <p>
              I don't start shit with people, but I have finished when they have.
             </p>
             <p>
              I am committed to non-violence but that doesn't men somebody can attack me and I will just let them.
             </p>
             <p>
              Bill needs to learn a lesson and writing to him ain't helping.
             </p>
             <p>
              What comes around goes around in the Real World.
             </p>
             <p>
              Bill seems to be unaware of this.
             </p>
            </div>
            <div class="cf">
             <p class="sig">
              <a href="http://www.chimpsternation.com/forum?c=showthread&amp;ThreadID=509" rel="nofollow">

         <ul class="cm i1" id="k12787724">
          <li id="c1407">
           <div class="cx" id="cx12791279">
            <h5>
             <a class="de">
             </a>
             <span class="cu">
              I generally agree
             </span>
             <span class="crd ntb">
              (
              <a href="/comments/364689/12791279#c1407?mode=alone;showrate=1#c1407">
               0+ / 0-
              </a>
              )
             </span>
            </h5>
            <div class="ct">
             <p>
              Stooping to his level is definitely not the solution and actions like Mikes should definitely not become habitual. That said, I do support what Mike did. I personally can see the irony in it and I think it is hillarious. If there is a touch of hypocrasy in that, I think it is a very minor hypocrasy that can be overlooked. However, if Mike or anyone else were to pull a similar stunt again supporting it while denouncing O'reilly's tactics would be severly hypocritical. If say in 2011 Hannity harasses someone at their home and someone give him a visit, I could support that.
             </p>
             <p>
              Giving them a taste of their own medicine every few years is acceptable to me. Shoving a funnel in their mouth and pooring down the whole bottle is not.
             </p>
             <p>
              The bottom line is, in my opinion, what Mike did goes into the grey area that we should not enter often but every now and again, under certain conditions is alright.
             </p>
            </div>
            <div class="cf">
             <p class="sig">

                    <li id="c411">
                     <div class="cx" id="cx12780735">
                      <h5>
                       <a class="de">
                       </a>
                       <span class="cu">
                        I'd like to think...
                       </span>
                       <span class="crd ntb">
                        (
                        <a href="/comments/364689/12780735#c411?mode=alone;showrate=1#c411">
                         9+ / 0-
                        </a>
                        )
                       </span>
                      </h5>
                      <div class="crs">
                       <dl>
                        <dt>
                         Recommended by:
                        </dt>
                        <dd>
                         <a href="/user/uid:181">
                          Rebecca
                         </a>
                         ,
                         <a href="/user/uid:1231">
                          sj
                         </a>
                         ,
                         <a href="/user/uid:51214">
                          Webster
                         </a>
                         ,
                         <a href="/user/uid:63264">
                          viscerality
                         </a>
                         ,
                         <a href="/user/uid:86626">
                          dotdot
                         </a>
                         ,
                         <a href="/user/uid:106912">
                          MichiganGirl
                         </a>
                         ,
                         <a href="/user/uid:121041">
                          CC Music Factory
                         </a>
                         ,
                         <a href="/user/uid:122606">
                          Horsefeathers
                         </a>
                         ,
                         <a href="/user/uid:122839">
                          kyril
                         </a>
                        </dd>
                       </dl>
                      </div>
                      <div class="ct">
                       <p>
                        ...that there is no difference distinguished by UID except the date of first contact in the gentle orange glow.
                       </p>
                       <p>
                        Let the words separate the people.
                        <br/>
                        Let their history distinguish them, and if they have little history, then challenge them with respect and allow them to respond.
                       </p>
                       <p>
                        I thought the beauty of this place is there is nothing to distinguish one person above another except the voice they use. Using UID as some classification is wholly unnecessary and is intellectually lazy.
                       </p>
                      </div>

                       <p class="sig">

              <div class="ct">
               <p>
                Why don't you bother explaining how it "tars us all" when posted here.
               </p>
               <p>
                I'm not at all unclear on what you mean. I just know you're wrong, and don't understand how you can be, if you read this site.
               </p>
               <p>
                If you're going to make such a strong claim in a site where it's been prebunked so thoroughly, so often, at the center of this entire conflict, then you've got to back it up. Flip, redundant answers like "three words" just make it clear that you can't.
               </p>
              </div>

                </div>
                <div class="ct">
                 <p>
                  Who cares what O'Reilly says? Are you really telling the diarist to delete because O'Reilly will say something? Something stupid, wrong, and at the heart of O'Reilly's stupid, wrong attacks (and hypocrisy)?
                 </p>
                 <p>
                  Why on Earth would anyone on DKos do anything because O'Reilly says so? Why are
                  <em>
                   you
                  </em>
                  backing O'Reilly?
                 </p>
                </div>
                <div class="cf">
                 <p class="sig">
                  "When the going gets weird, the weird
                  <a href="http://www.dailykos.com/user/DocGonzo/diary" rel="nofollow">

           <li id="c132">
            <div class="cx" id="cx12779942">
             <h5>
              <a class="de">
              </a>
              <span class="cu">
               Do you really think DailyKos
              </span>
              <span class="crd ntb">
               (
               <a href="/comments/364689/12779942#c132?mode=alone;showrate=1#c132">
                11+ / 0-
               </a>
               )
              </span>
             </h5>
             <div class="crs">
              <dl>
               <dt>
                Recommended by:
               </dt>
               <dd>
                <a href="/user/uid:181">
                 Rebecca
                </a>
                ,
                <a href="/user/uid:18934">
                 Boston Boomer
                </a>
                ,
                <a href="/user/uid:22634">
                 als10
                </a>
                ,
                <a href="/user/uid:32469">
                 limaike
                </a>
                ,
                <a href="/user/uid:33525">
                 Builderman
                </a>
                ,
                <a href="/user/uid:41104">
                 bablhous
                </a>
                ,
                <a href="/user/uid:54433">
                 boofdah
                </a>
                ,
                <a href="/user/uid:77390">
                 Horsehead
                </a>
                ,
                <a href="/user/uid:78875">
                 Timothy J
                </a>
                ,
                <a href="/user/uid:79484">
                 ticket punch
                </a>
                ,
                <a href="/user/uid:104129">
                 rrheard
                </a>
               </dd>
              </dl>
             </div>
             <div class="ct">
              <p>
               would come out of those proceedings looking worse than Bill O'Reilly?
              </p>
              <p>
               Sure, Fox would try to tie the site to Mike in publicity, but legally they wouldn't have a case. I think it would end up attracting curious people to the site who would see immediately that progressive politics was the real focus.
              </p>
              <p>
               As for Bill, how anxious is he to hear the falafel/loofah incidents aired on national news again?
              </p>

            <h5>
             <a class="de">
             </a>
             <span class="cu">
              Mama said there'd be days like this,
             </span>
             <span class="crd ntb">
              (
              <a href="/comments/364689/12780797#c437?mode=alone;showrate=1#c437">
               5+ / 0-
              </a>
              )
             </span>
            </h5>
            <div class="crs">

              </dt>
              <dd>

               </a>

               </a>

               <a href="/user/uid:37130">

             </dl>
            </div>
            <div class="ct">
             <p>
              there'd be days like this, my mama said ...
             </p>
             <p>
              Hi, Eddie! :)
             </p>
            </div>

          <li id="c986">
           <div class="cx" id="cx12783765">
            <h5>
             <a class="de">
             </a>
             <span class="cu">
              Me either, Eddie
             </span>
             <span class="crd ntb">
              (
              <a href="/comments/364689/12783765#c986?mode=alone;showrate=1#c986">
               6+ / 0-
              </a>
              )
             </span>
            </h5>
            <div class="crs">
             <dl>
              <dt>
               Recommended by:
              </dt>
              <dd>
               <a href="/user/uid:24682">
                lorri
               </a>
               ,
               <a href="/user/uid:28222">
                sele
               </a>
               ,
               <a href="/user/uid:37130">
                Eddie Haskell
               </a>
               ,
               <a href="/user/uid:64115">
                Over the Edge
               </a>
               ,
               <a href="/user/uid:76109">
                totallynext
               </a>
               ,
               <a href="/user/uid:104483">
                Curufinwe
               </a>
              </dd>
             </dl>
            </div>
            <div class="ct">
             <blockquote>
              <p>
               I am usually proud of my affiliation with DailyKos. Today, I am not.
              </p>
             </blockquote>
             <p>
              Oh, and Mike? First of all, journalists don't post signs around a subject's neighborhood, calling him names. They don't put copies of a lawsuit in the neighbor's door or mailbox. So, PLEASE, stop saying you were acting like a journalist. You weren't. And as for your "update" telling me to put my concerns in my own diary, who the fuck do you think you are? You post a diary, I get to comment in it. I can even CRITICIZE you in the comment. That's the way it goes here, and you damn well know it. That kind of update gives me a really bad feeling about what you may have said to Billo. Here's hoping you didn't say you speak for DailyKos, because you don't. You're not Kos, and to my knowledge, not a FP. Therefore, you don't speak for DailyKos. Not like THAT is going to help now.
             </p>
             <p>
              And for all of you nitwits out there who thought this was so fucking brilliant, I am SO sick and tired of hearing "they do it to us, so let's do it to them". Here's a clue - your mother didn't think that was so smart, did she? Because whenever I told my mother that I did something wrong because someone else did it, I was told that two wrongs never made a right. And posting signs around his house calling him a pervert is WRONG.
             </p>
             <p>
              But, hey Mike, way to go. You're a law student? Do me a favor and DON'T become a lawyer. My profession has enough problems as it is.
             </p>
            </div>

              <a href="/user/uid:69938">
               kestrel9000
              </a>
              ,
              <a href="/user/uid:73845">
               figleef
              </a>
              ,
              <a href="/user/uid:75492">
               Dauphin
              </a>
              ,
              <a href="/user/uid:122839">
               kyril
              </a>
             </dd>
            </dl>
           </div>
           <div class="ct">
            <p>
             If it's true, and a matter of public record - which it is - it's not "slander".
            </p>
            <p>
             Are you a lawyer? How did you protect your client from those charges, if indeed they publicized true public info?
            </p>
           </div>
           <div class="cf">
            <p class="sig">
             "When the going gets weird, the weird
             <a href="http://www.dailykos.com/user/DocGonzo/diary" rel="nofollow">
              turn pro
             </a>
             ." - HST
            </p>

          <li id="c516">
           <div class="cx" id="cx12781004">
            <h5>
             <a class="de">
             </a>
             <span class="cu">
              It's an allegation
             </span>
             <span class="crd ntb">
              (
              <a href="/comments/364689/12781004#c516?mode=alone;showrate=1#c516">
               0+ / 0-
              </a>
              )
             </span>
            </h5>
            <div class="ct">
             <p>
              It was never proven in a court of law. Bill settled out of court with no admission of liability. Not the same as "true," is all I'm saying. The sign that says he's a pervert is a long way from "reporting the truth" as a legal matter.
             </p>

         <li id="c786">
          <div class="cx" id="cx12782002">
           <h5>
            <a class="de">
            </a>
            <span class="cu">
             Neither libel nor slander, but
            </span>
            <span class="crd ntb">
             (
             <a href="/comments/364689/12782002#c786?mode=alone;showrate=1#c786">
              1+ / 0-
             </a>
             )
            </span>
           </h5>
           <div class="crs">
            <dl>
             <dt>
              Recommended by:
             </dt>
             <dd>
              <a href="/user/uid:21185">
               sarahnity
              </a>
             </dd>
            </dl>
           </div>
           <div class="ct">
            <p>
             leaving the sign on private property gets problematic.
            </p>
            <p>
             <a href="http://laws.findlaw.com/us/487/474.html">
              FRISBY v. SCHULTZ, 487 U.S. 474 (1988)
             </a>
             holds that residential privacy may, in some circumstances, trump speech rights that would otherwise be protected (picketing on sidewalks in residential neighborhoods) if there's a content-neutral ordinance in place. Not knowing O'Reilly's place of residence, I can't research the ordinances, but using his yard goes betond using the public sidewalk.
            </p>
           </div>
           <div class="cf">
            <p class="sig">
             Democratic Candidate for US Senator, Wisconsin, in 2012
             <br/>
             <br/>
             Abolish Mandatory Minimum Sentences. Don't wait 'til you're President.

          <div class="ct">
           <p>
            Sweet. Hopefully the video includes a camera in Bill's face and an obnoxious questioner asking:
           </p>
           <p>
            "Mr. O'Reilly you've been accused of using McCarthyite tactics to smear Democrats and Liberals. Do you think Jetblue and Home Depot are aware that you regularly lie on your show?"
           </p>
           <p>
            [O'Reilly walks away]
           </p>
           <p>
            [QUESTIONER SHOUTING]
           </p>
           <p>
            MISTER O'REILLY IS JETBLUE AWARE OF YOUR SEXUAL HARASSMENT? DOES HOME DEPOT KNOW YOU REFER TO MEXICANS AS WETBACKS??? MR O'REILLY PLEASE ANSWER OUR QUESTIONS!!
           </p>
           <p>
            No matter whether it went down like that or not ... no one deserves to have a camera shoved in their face on their home turf more than Bill O'Reilly.
           </p>
           <p>
            _
           </p>
          </div>
          <div class="cf">
           <p class="sig">

           <p class="cb">
            by
            <a href="/user/uid:39417">
             Curt Matlock

          <div class="ct">
           <p>
            quite a disappointment for such a cable teevee mogul.
           </p>
           <p>
            White siding? Giant mailbox by the garage? Cheesy light fixture that looks like it came from WalMart?
           </p>
           <p>
            Not even a paver driveway? Blacktop for a guy with a black heart?
           </p>
           <p>
            I am so disappointed.
           </p>
           <p>
            No gates, no guard house with armed guards, no guard dog, no chauffeur,
            <br/>
            no huge limo idling to whisk him away to his very important job.
           </p>
           <p>
            Plus who wears red boxer shorts? Maybe they match his red vibrator?

            <h5>
             <a class="de">
             </a>
             <span class="cu">
              you know...
             </span>
             <span class="crd ntb">

              <a href="/comments/364689/12781104#c551?mode=alone;showrate=1#c551">

              </dd>

            </div>
            <div class="ct">
             <p>
              I was vaguely concerned about this diary when I got here. I have to admit that. Amused, but concerned. But you, I'm afraid, are completely discrediting any case you might have had with your over-the-top accusations and trollish demeanor - which, by your history, isn't at all unusual for you.
             </p>
             <p>
              So while I was planning to post some sort of inane comment about how I hoped Mike was sure he was on the right side of the law, I can't bear to be on the same side of the issue as the kumquats like you who are concern-trolling this diary. I imagine I'm not the only one who's felt this way reading through the comments.
             </p>

                <div class="ct">
                 <ol>
                  <li value="1">
                   I never refuted the argument. In fact, I still think you have a point. I just told you that the way you were making your argument was counterproductive - much like the way Mike made his statement against Bill-O may have been counterproductive.
                  </li>
                 </ol>
                 <ol>
                  <li value="2">
                   I never attacked you. Unless you're somehow deeply offended by being called a kumquat, in which case...well, I've called my husband much worse things when I was irritated. But other than that, my entire comment was discussing the way you were talking, not what you were saying.
                  </li>
                 </ol>
                 <p>
                  So that would make your "ad hominem" assertion...bullshit.
                 </p>

          <li id="c151">
           <div class="cx" id="cx12780001">
            <h5>
             <a class="de">
             </a>
             <span class="cu">
              well, when I was a kid
             </span>
             <span class="crd ntb">
              (
              <a href="/comments/364689/12780001#c151?mode=alone;showrate=1#c151">
               13+ / 0-
              </a>
              )
             </span>
            </h5>
            <div class="crs">
             <dl>
              <dt>
               Recommended by:
              </dt>
              <dd>
               <a href="/user/uid:181">
                Rebecca
               </a>
               ,
               <a href="/user/uid:18934">
                Boston Boomer
               </a>
               ,
               <a href="/user/uid:37123">
                Timbuk3
               </a>
               ,
               <a href="/user/uid:41104">
                bablhous
               </a>
               ,
               <a href="/user/uid:46027">
                pattyp
               </a>
               ,
               <a href="/user/uid:60572">
                Floja Roja
               </a>
               ,
               <a href="/user/uid:63264">
                viscerality
               </a>
               ,
               <a href="/user/uid:65907">
                buddabelly
               </a>
               ,
               <a href="/user/uid:78875">
                Timothy J
               </a>
               ,
               <a href="/user/uid:80883">
                pissedpatriot
               </a>
               ,
               <a href="/user/uid:86626">
                dotdot
               </a>
               ,
               <a href="/user/uid:122839">
                kyril
               </a>
               ,
               <a href="/user/uid:129500">
                SteamPunkX
               </a>
              </dd>
             </dl>
            </div>
            <div class="ct">
             <p>
              I was a small boy - in height/weight. I was routinely picked on, beat up, you know - all the typical stuff.
             </p>
             <p>
              It ended when I fought back - not by calling the other kids' parents, not by talking reason to them. It ended when I was being beat up and I picked up a trash can and went nuts on two other kids who were beating on me. I fought dirty. Funny thing, I was never picked on again.
             </p>
             <p>
              And I have no contacts, glasses, or any impairment in my vision.
             </p>
             <p>
              jus' sayin'
             </p>
            </div>
            <div class="cf">
             <p class="sig">
             </p>
             <p class="cb">
              by
              <a href="/user/uid:42949">
               Sol Fed Joe
              </a>
              on
              <a href="/comments/364689/12780001#c151">

              </a>
             </p>
             <p class="cl">
              [
              <a href="#c105">
               Parent
              </a>
              ]
             </p>
            </div>
           </div>

             <div class="ct">
              <p>
               I got ruthlessly beat up up until high school.. My mom always said never fight back it's wrong, and for years I didn't, and the abuse continued. Then one day I snapped, I beat up the bullies one by one, they never bothered me again. The funny thing is that they actually approached me and apologized and wanted to be my friend.
              </p>

               <ul class="cm i1" id="k12780653">
                <li id="c573">
                 <div class="cx" id="cx12781167">
                  <h5>
                   <a class="de">
                   </a>
                   <span class="cu">
                    Here's the transcript from foxnews.com
                   </span>
                   <span class="crd ntb">
                    (
                    <a href="/comments/364689/12781167#c573?mode=alone;showrate=1#c573">
                     0+ / 0-
                    </a>
                    )
                   </span>
                  </h5>
                  <div class="ct">
                   <p>
                    <a href="http://www.foxnews.com/story/0,2933,289573,00.html">
                     without comment:
                    </a>
                   </p>
                   <blockquote>
                    <p>
                     (BEGIN VIDEO CLIP)
                    </p>
                    <p>
                     JESSE WATTERS, FOX NEWS: Hey, Mr. Barger, Jesse Watters with FOX News. How are you?
                    </p>
                    <p>
                     DAVID BARGER, JETBLUE CEO: Good morning.
                    </p>
                    <p>
                     WATTERS: Good morning. Do you mind if we ask you a few questions?
                    </p>
                    <p>
                     BARGER: Regarding?
                    </p>
                    <p>
                     WATTERS: On the DailyKos Web site, it says attacks against coalition forces in Iraq are legitimate. Does JetBlue subscribe to that kind of thinking?
                    </p>
                    <p>
                     BARGER: There's really, you know, politics and our business. It's really not something that we mix.
                    </p>
                    <p>
                     WATTERS: What about the pope is a primate? Do you agree with that kind of thinking?
                    </p>
                    <p>
                     BARGER: Same. I mean, it's -- from the standpoint of running our business, that's what we do from an airline perspective. So there's really not alignment along those lines. I appreciate your interest.
                    </p>
                    <p>
                     WATTERS: Do you think you're giving legitimacy to this kind of thinking? I mean, they're saying the world may be better off without Tony Snow when Tony Snow had a cancer relapse.
                    </p>
                    <p>
                     BARGER: It's -- I'm really not going to mix politics from the standpoint of running our business.
                    </p>
                    <p>
                     WATTERS: And aren't you guys kind of mixing politics by, you know, sponsoring this convention?
                    </p>
                    <p>
                     BARGER: It's -- it's -- I can see where you're trying to go with it, but it's -- I'm just not going to, you know, to respond to that here at this point and time.
                    </p>
                    <p>
                     WATTERS: Don't you think your sponsorship is kind of attached endorsement to this kind of thinking?
                    </p>
                    <p>
                     BARGER: I think just the ability to leave my apartment and do that freely and go to work is really what I'm trying to do. And along those lines, I think the people can draw their own conclusion. We're running our business. And from the perspective of politics, there's not alignment. So thanks very much.
                    </p>
                    <p>
                     WATTERS: Thank you. I mean, do you think that your JetBlue customers want to know that you're kind of subscribing to the belief that Iran has the right to attack Israel? I mean, these are the kind of things they're saying on this Web site.
                    </p>
                    <p>
                     BARGER: I'll just close by saying this: I think our customers are -- I'll treat them with dignity and respect. They're very smart. They'll draw their own conclusion, whether it's watching your new show, whether it's watching our in-flight television. They're pretty smart people. They'll draw their own conclusion.
                    </p>
                    <p>
                     (END VIDEO CLIP)
                    </p>
                   </blockquote>
                  </div>

            <p>

              </p>

              <a href="/user/uid:86626">
               dotdot
              </a>
              ,
              <a href="/user/uid:106912">
               MichiganGirl
              </a>
              ,
              <a href="/user/uid:122839">
               kyril
              </a>
             </dd>
            </dl>
           </div>
           <div class="ct">
            <p>
             You know what? If Fox viewers come over here and see that people on the same side can disagree, maybe it will be an education.
            </p>
            <p>
             I think it's a Michael Moore-ish stunt and like some of his may be more funny than useful, and yes there may be some backlash, but at the same time it was kept within legal bounds.
            </p>
            <p>
             I have been worried for years about the increasing wingnut tactic (anti-choicers, Michelle Malkin) of posting actual addresses on their websites and inviting violent retribution against their perceived enemies. Perhaps Mike's visit might cause some of Bill's fans to begin to think that maybe that's not such a great idea.
            </p>
            <p>
             Mike, you've prompted a vigorous and passionate debate. And if nothing else, I thank you for that. That's what democracy looks and sounds like and I'm glad to see it back in my country.
            </p>
           </div>
           <div class="cf">
            <p class="sig">
            </p>
            <p class="cb">
             by
             <a href="/user/uid:11078">
              rppa
             </a>
             on
             <a href="/comments/364689/12780502#c327">
              Tue Jul 31, 2007 at 07:35:01 AM PDT
             </a>
            </p>
            <p class="cl">
             [
             <a href="#c95">
              Parent
             </a>
             ]
            </p>
           </div>
          </div>
         </li>
         <ul class="cm i1" id="k12780502">
          <li id="c1206">
           <div class="cx" id="cx12787277">
            <h5>
             <a class="de">
             </a>
             <span class="cu">
              Malkin's links to New York Times vacation homes
             </span>
             <span class="crd ntb">
              (
              <a href="/comments/364689/12787277#c1206?mode=alone;showrate=1#c1206">
               0+ / 0-
              </a>
              )
             </span>
            </h5>
            <div class="ct">
             <p>
              were especially disturbing... She published links to addresses, actually encouraged her readers to make themselves known to the Sulzbergers. On her site, Malkin published the telephone numbers of campus student activists, who received threats.
             </p>
             <p>
              As a Kossack, I was distressed seeing them both talk about Daily Kos as a "hate site" yesterday, knowing Malkin's track record in particular. That is so far from the case. This is an extraordinarily compassionate community, and it has achieved real political results.
             </p>
             <p>
              I disagree with what Mike did to O'Reilly... I think it was childish. He does have a point, of sorts, in that O'Reilly has threatened many times to show up at peoples' homes.
             </p>
            </div>

        <ul class="cm i1" id="k12779884">
         <li id="c162">
          <div class="cx" id="cx12780038">
           <h5>
            <a class="de">
            </a>
            <span class="cu">
             No, it's wrong in this instance too
            </span>
            <span class="crd ntb">
             (
             <a href="/comments/364689/12780038#c162?mode=alone;showrate=1#c162">
              7+ / 0-
             </a>
             )
            </span>
           </h5>
           <div class="crs">
            <dl>
             <dt>
              Recommended by:
             </dt>
             <dd>
              <a href="/user/uid:9240">
               Yoshimi
              </a>
              ,
              <a href="/user/uid:24682">
               lorri
              </a>
              ,
              <a href="/user/uid:28054">
               celticshel
              </a>
              ,
              <a href="/user/uid:31985">
               milton333
              </a>
              ,
              <a href="/user/uid:41648">
               Scout Finch
              </a>
              ,
              <a href="/user/uid:76109">
               totallynext
              </a>
              ,
              <a href="/user/uid:110850">
               AJsMom
              </a>
             </dd>
            </dl>
           </div>
           <div class="ct">
            <p>
             Don't get me wrong, I really dislike Bill O'Reilly. The man's a scumbag. However, posting signs in his front yard and bugging all his neighbors? That makes me uncomfortable.
            </p>
            <p>
             I see absolutely nothing wrong with picketing in front of the white house, the congress, or the supreme court. That's fine. They're huge, government-owned compounds with their own security.
            </p>
            <p>
             In a private home, though, things have potential to go badly. It only takes one over-zealous protester caught up in the moment to run onto O'Reilly's front yard and throw a rock, and suddenly Bill might be legally justified in shooting him. And what about his poor neighbors who have to worry about the crazy protesters in front of their neighbor's house. Bill's got a lot of enemies, and some of them ARE dangerous.
            </p>
            <p>
             We should absolutely picket him at his studio, but at his home? That makes me uncomfortable.
            </p>
           </div>
           <div class="cf">
            <p class="sig">
            </p>
            <p class="cb">
             by
             <a href="/user/uid:121675">
              MrFakeName
             </a>
             on
             <a href="/comments/364689/12780038#c162">
              Tue Jul 31, 2007 at 07:09:05 AM PDT
             </a>
            </p>
            <p class="cl">
             [
             <a href="#c117">
              Parent
             </a>
             ]
            </p>

         <ul class="cm i1" id="k12780038">
          <li id="c223">
           <div class="cx" id="cx12780237">
            <h5>
             <a class="de">

           <li id="c853">
            <div class="cx" id="cx12782484">
             <h5>
              <a class="de">
              </a>
              <span class="cu">
               the update where he says protesting is reporting?
              </span>
              <span class="crd ntb">
               (
               <a href="/comments/364689/12782484#c853?mode=alone;showrate=1#c853">
                4+ / 0-
               </a>
               )
              </span>
             </h5>
             <div class="crs">
              <dl>
               <dt>
                Recommended by:
               </dt>
               <dd>
                <a href="/user/uid:24682">
                 lorri
                </a>
                ,
                <a href="/user/uid:28054">
                 celticshel
                </a>
                ,
                <a href="/user/uid:28222">
                 sele
                </a>
                ,
                <a href="/user/uid:110850">
                 AJsMom
                </a>
               </dd>
              </dl>
             </div>
             <div class="ct">
              <p>
               Look, O'Reilly was threatening a stupid tactic, one I also don't agree with. While I find that irony and turnabout is very compelling from a metaphorical perspective, you can't go out and do something just because the other person threatened to do it first and claim that it's okay. The relevant expression involves a couple of wrongs and their unsuccessful right-making.
              </p>
              <p>
               If O'Reilly threatened to shoot Mike at his home, would it have been okay for Mike to go to O'Reilly's home and murder him? Of course not.
              </p>
              <p>
               The reason we mock O'Reilly is because he's a nutjob. We don't do think because O'Reilly threatens to do them. In fact, any time O'Reilly does the same thing we do, there's a good chance that we're doing something wrong.
              </p>
             </div>
             <div class="cf">
              <p class="sig">
              </p>

             <h5>
              <a class="de">
              </a>
              <span class="cu">
               agreed - comments are for commenting
              </span>
              <span class="crd ntb">
               (
               <a href="/comments/364689/12780219#c217?mode=alone;showrate=1#c217">
                19+ / 0-
               </a>
               )
              </span>
             </h5>
             <div class="crs">
              <dl>
               <dt>
                Recommended by:
               </dt>
               <dd>
                <a href="/user/uid:5098">
                 AaronInSanDiego
                </a>
                ,
                <a href="/user/uid:6011">
                 DelRPCV
                </a>

                <a href="/user/uid:13207">

                </a>

                </a>

                <a href="/user/uid:21185">

                </a>

                <a href="/user/uid:23044">
                 wanderindiana
                </a>
                ,
                <a href="/user/uid:28054">
                 celticshel
                </a>
                ,
                <a href="/user/uid:28895">
                 revsue
                </a>
                ,
                <a href="/user/uid:31985">
                 milton333
                </a>
                ,
                <a href="/user/uid:55007">
                 zombie
                </a>
                ,
                <a href="/user/uid:59895">
                 The Raven
                </a>
                ,
                <a href="/user/uid:76109">
                 totallynext
                </a>
                ,
                <a href="/user/uid:79710">
                 poppyseed
                </a>
                ,
                <a href="/user/uid:103503">
                 bethyb
                </a>
                ,
                <a href="/user/uid:105233">
                 echohotel330
                </a>
                ,
                <a href="/user/uid:111341">
                 AnnieJo
                </a>
                ,
                <a href="/user/uid:111914">
                 Sicembears
                </a>
                ,
                <a href="/user/uid:116091">
                 Break On Through
                </a>
                ,
                <a href="/user/uid:120053">
                 war is peace
                </a>
               </dd>
              </dl>
             </div>
             <div class="ct">
              <p>
               This "go write your own diary" is a load of dung. Mike, you have more guts than just about anybody I know and I would never say that O'Lielly doesn't deserve this, but don't tell people who are fairly and appropriately commenting on your diary to take their complaints to their own diary.
              </p>
              <p>
               The comments function is there so people can relay what they think about a diary, whether it's laudatory or critical. It's fine to defend what you've done and why you've done it in an update, but saying "take your complaints to your own diary" is, IMO, a bunch of crap and beneath you.
              </p>
             </div>
             <div class="cf">
              <p class="sig">
               "We didn't create this fetid political swamp, we just live in it." - Digby
              </p>
              <p class="cb">
               by
               <a href="/user/uid:69412">
                Whigsboy
               </a>
               on
               <a href="/comments/364689/12780219#c217">

               </a>
              </p>
              <p class="cl">
               [
               <a href="#c155">
                Parent
               </a>
               ]
              </p>
             </div>
            </div>

            <div class="ct">
             <p>
              One's plenty.
             </p>
             <p>
              When you put up a diary, you implicitly invite the community to respond with what they think. That's exactly where the responses
              <strong>
               should
              </strong>
              go.
             </p>
             <p>
              Calling your respondents concern-trolls just for disagreeing with you, and ordering them to clear out of your diary, is not cool in the slightest.
             </p>
